description:
Oh my god! I can't describe how delicious the food in this place was! The taste was outstanding! And you can bring your own beer.... 
I was a little bit not excited to come here because it looked kinda ugly, but it is actually ok looking inside and the food will erase any kind of judgment that you can have towards this place.
Also the guy that was working was very friendly and smiled at us all the time. 
I am definitely coming back!
author: Daniela T.

description:
Called to get takeout from this place. It took about 10 minutes until it was ready. The restaurant looked a little dusty and there wasn't a lot of people which meant that the wait wouldn't be bad.  I decided to get the Lamb Korma. 

Lamb Korma- Pretty good. The sauce was very creamy and there was plenty of lamb. The sauce was a little too creamy for my taste, but the flavoring nonetheless was pretty good. The lamb could have been more tender, but wasn't bad. I felt that the dish could have used some spiciness. 

Overall, I would come here again and try more dishes from the menu.
author: Felicia C.

description:
This is how raw the tandoori chicken was - no flavor and thought it was under cooked till I pulled it apart... ugh worst tandoori I hard EVER
Also the biryani has only 4 small pieces of chicken
Hate to go for a new restaurant when they cut corners like this
Can there be 0 stars
author: Sameer B.

description:
A quintessential quality "ethnic" restaurant where food quality outweighs ambiance and service. 

VERY good food such that they don't need any bells and whistles with their ambiance and service to get repeat customers.

My friend and I were the only white folks in the place, which is always a good sign of quality food :)
author: Katherine G.

description:
I wanted a low key feel comfortable in your sweater and leggings dinner date with my husband and this place was perfect!! I ordered...
Onion naan - it was delicious with chunks of onion and cilantro pieces.
Garlic naan - delicious! With garlic flavoring (my favorite of the two) 
*side tip you can get your brown and green chutney in the fridge section to dip your naan in.
Saag paneer - wonderful! With large chunks of paneer in it. It was mildly spicy and delicious over rice.
Lamb masala - the sauce was creamy and really good with the naan and rice!!
I was impressed by how clean the tables we're and how friendly the staff was. I will be back to try the other menu items in the future!! :)
author: Sara S.

description:
I asked for a recommendation since I wanted to get something that's not tikka masala - the owner/cashier recommended Chicken Korma, I'm so impressed! The curry was not too spicy, but flavorful enough. The garlic naan went perfectly with the flavorful curry in the chicken korma. The chicken was tender and delicious, you can taste the freshness as you bite into it.

Pretty small place, but the tables and dishes are very clean. Very friendly service. And don't forget grab some fennel seeds to chew before you leave!
author: Iris H.

description: I love Indian/Pakistani food!!!! Have to say, the flavor is definitely there! Portions are just right but hubby think they are small.  Loved everything but the chicken in my butter chicken. Chicken wasn't soft enough for me to eat it with a naan with my hands. I think the chicken should kinda fall apart when you smoosh it with your naan? It felt dry... that was a bummer. The guy at the counter was very nice!
author: Alex K.

description:
I had incredible karahis in DC area.
Ravi Kabob in Arlington VA was one of them.
since that day I've been looking for a really good Pakistani Karahi in San Francisco, and I came across this place while I was walking in Tenderloin  in search of a lamb karahi (or lamb brain karahi) to no avail.
with the name like that lahore karahi doesn't even have authentic Pakistani staple menu like lamb karahi, or chapli kabob, not to mention lamb brain karahi on their menu.
but I was already inside, and I decided to order anyway in case I'm in for a real tasty surprise.
nope.
nothing.
and not exactly cheap considering the ambiance of the place, the presentation of the food and the value of your money.
author: Rudy H.

description: Great spices, they adjust to your liking of spicy. Best lamb chops, and tandoori leg and kebabs. They have very limited seating and are located in a somewhat questionable area, but serve the best tasting in town. I've enjoyed everything I have ordered. Prices are on the lower side of reasonable and service is typically quick. This is my favorite restaurant for Indian food to go.
author: Terrell H.

description:
Delicious authentic style Indian! Good service and good prices. Tasty free chai. Good fresh naan-pretty big too! 

Everything's good, but recommend
- Mix veg
- Paneer tikka masala
- Naan

The only reason it loses a star is vibe and tenderloin location. Not the best date place. A regular eatery.
author: Aakash G.

description: Surprisingly flavorful and cooked fresh! The tandoori chicken was excellently seasoned. The lamb tikka masala went very well with the cheese naan that we cleaned the whole bowl.
author: Xinyu L.

description:
This place is soooo good! Delish! Food is from the heart and served with a smile! Hope they raise their prices a bit so they are able to make a decent living and never have to close their doors. 
Thank you!
author: Elena N.

description:
Absolutely everything was delicious except for the raita, it had a little too much carrot not enough cucumber but still good. 

Lamb tikka was slow braised and packed with creamy flavor/

The simple basmati rice was fluffy and pleasant and paired nicely with all dishes

The chicken and cheese naan was like a sauce less inside out pizza, not sure how they did it but it was great and actually tasted like a basic garlic pizza
author: Megan K.

description:
I went to the other Pakistani restaurant a couple blocks away (one of my favs), instinctively got a "No" and came here. Although the place was filled with dirty plates when I walked in (they were quickly cleared), it felt good. 

Based on reviews about the Chicken Karahi, that's what I got. The curry isn't over the top spicy. It tastes flavorful and onion-y. The chicken is moist and really good. 

Because a Yelper raved about the Saag Paneer (spinach with cheese), I got that too. I couldn't stop eating it. It isn't like one I've ever tasted. It is rich and really super good!!!! 

And a nan... covered in ghee, it was thick and divine!!!

Have to agree that they have the best chai tea. I wouldn't have tried it had a Yelper not raved about it. How do they get it to be sooo thick and yummy?!!! 

This is now my new favorite Pakistani restaurant!!!! 

(Lahore is a city in Pakistan close to the border of India.)
author: AnneMarie W.

description:
Hole in the wall and sooooo good. 

I walked down the ever so sketchy eddy street to taste this delicious place. 

8-9$ per plate. 
Naan bread came with onion Mmmmmm!!!
Banghan bartha - always my favorite
Lamb boughan (?) deliciousness. Spicy 


My friend and I are so full and happy. We did not finish the massive naan bread.
author: Bao-Quynh J.

description:
I happened to walk past Lahore Karahi when I walking on O'Farell street and was immediately drawn by the aroma of the place. I quickly pulled out my phone to check it out on Yelp and wasn't surprised when I noticed that it was pretty highly rated. Yes, the aroma was good enough! 

Once we were done with our work in the neighborhood, we walked back to the establishment and ordered two Garlic Naan's and a plate of Chicken Karahi (recommended by the owner) between two people. The food was promptly brought to our table by one of the servers as we were just about settling down after grabbing a can of soda and a bottle of water. 

It is important to note that I set a high bar for an Indian/Pakistani place serving Chicken Karahi and in my heart, I really wanted this place to go above and beyond. The people behind the counter were sweet and the smell of the food was on point. 

If I'm being completely honest about it, the Chicken Karahi looked bang average when it arrived at our table and I was a little unsure of how it was going to taste. That along with the fact that it was missing the bell peppers we were promised on the menu, made me feel a little let down. 

All of my doubts vanished once I tasted the food and it was only after I had gobbled up my meal that I looked up and said another word. While Lahore Karahi din't turn out to be exceptional, it did just about meet the bar for a great place that serves authentic Pakistani food.

Would recommend it to people looking for good food in the city.
author: Gaurav K.

description:
I wonder what I have been doing all this while without reviewing Lahore Karahi. We have been regulars here for over an year. I love their food and Mango Lassi. They have complimentary chai which is pretty good. My go-to order is shahi paneer tikka masala, saag paneer , onion naan and garlic naan. Their onion naan is to die for. The staff here are super friendly and the order is quite quick. So we are in and out of the restaurant 
In less than an hour. It's not a fancy restaurant and the prices are very decent. Definitely try this place when in San Francisco.
author: Sailaja B.

description: Delicious  food. Garlic naan was sooo good. Also ordered samosas, chicken sag, and chicken tikka masala. Samosas were very crisp, spicy, a lot of flavor. 2 large piece for appetizer portion. Chicken tikka masala was yummy- this sauce was creamy and flavorful. Chicken sag was also very good, finished the entire bowl. Restaurant space is very casual, not super clean or decorated or anything. Service was okay, seemed like more of a self serve place/take out place. not the best are, but we saw quite a few people get take out while we were eating. Small dining space. Fast service though and very reasonable prices!!
author: Amanda C.

description:
This is a great place to come if you feel like being treated poorly and lied to, also the food is BASIC and uninspired. After hearing so much about this place I decided to try it for myself, I went in with 35 minutes to spare until my next meeting and ordered a few dishes. After about 20 minutes a friend of the two guys behind the counter came in and started chatting them up. I then watched as this jackass was given the food that I had ordered. When I asked about it, I was told that mine is coming up. I had to wait another 20 minutes because they had to cook all new dishes ( I should have asked for a refund and left but I was so hungry.) Not only was I late because of the liar behind the counter, but the food was undercooked and nothing special. 
Customer service means nothing to these fools.
author: Glenn G.

description: Delicious, cheap, awesome food! Definitely recommend this spot for some satisfying food. Yum!
author: Petrea R.

description: Ordered the $16 goat curry. I got a lot of bones with no meat on them and two Tiny pieces of meat in the bottom that were really dry.  Curry was also yellow in color - tasted ok but I have no idea what gave it that color.   The tandoori chicken was also small but tasted good. Will not order from them again.
author: reza n.

description:
I LOVE paneer. I ate it every day for three weeks straight when I was in Bangalore, that's how much I  love it.

And this place has some of the best paneer I've ever had.

Everything else was delicious too.
author: Chad W.

description: This is the spot to go!!! The food is hella good especially when I have a craving for Indian food. I usually get the Chicken Tikka Masala & Garlic Naan. Today I got the Chicken Biryani w/ a side of Tikka masala sauce. Im pretty sure anything you order here will be delicious. I have also tried the Tandoori Chicken which was good too but kinda dry might have been over cooked.
author: Ryan M.

description: I had the Butter Chicken here and it was so good and creamy! The mains don't include naan or rice though
author: Sophia L.

description: This is not Lahori food. This is Indian food. The owners should clearly state this and not advertise this as Pakistani or lahori food
author: Bogus B.

description: Got takeout here, ordered garlic naan, rice, chicken tikka masala and saag paneer. Garlic naan was great, but everything else was too watery. The paneer was cut into huge blocks, so the cheese wasn't particularly flavorful and the chicken tasted dry. Delivery experience was fine
author: Melissa T.

description:
Found this place on Yelp by the FOOD reviews and it was delicious! The people who work here work hard and make super tasty food, plane and simple. Don't come if you're expecting something other than a hole in the wall and to be waited on hand and foot by your server, just get the food to go. Personally, I would always rather eat yummy authentic food, like this place has to offer - then pay more for a hipster atmosphere. 

The Chicken Tika Masala, Garlic Nan, and Lamb Korma were well balanced, tender and seasoned to perfection.  I even had some leftovers that were amazing the next day!
author: Abigail S.

description:
Lahore Karahi is one of my favorite Pakistani/Indian restaurant in The City. Before anything this place is not beautiful its not a luxurious place. BUT the food is great!

What I love getting at Lahore Karahi is their:

Chiken Tandoori: Tender & moist, comes with a few lemon wedges and onions.

Chicken Karahi: THIS IS MY ALL time favorite dish. It has a hint of spice and the curry is amazing. Just like the tandoori chicken the chicken that's in the Karahi is super tender. 

Chicken/Lamb Tikka Masala: Their chicken, again, tender and moist. This is the most delicious Chicken Tikka Masala that I have ever had. Their Masala is creamy and full of flavor. Their lamb is just like their chicken juicy, tender and moist!

Along with these dishes we usually order naan and roti.

A must try place! Just remember it is NOT a fancy place!
author: Alondra J.

description: I really hate to be that person... but here I am.  Ordered Aloo Ghobi and Garlic Naan for a quick take out dinner.  The Aloo Ghobi was lacking all flavor and was dry- did they forget to put the spices in?  I've never had Indian Food that I didn't finish, until now!  Maybe I chose the wrong dish? Or maybe they were having a off night?  Major bummed out! Wish I would have saved my $14.
author: Pamela R.

description: Ordered this food when visiting San Francisco. Ordered through Door Dash to my hotel. This food as soooooooo good. I was in heaven. I ordered lamb curry with rice and chicken vindaloo I believe. Perfect spice and was so flavorful AND WAS HOT when it arrived. Would definitely order from this place again. Word of advice, if you order a side of rice it is not going to be enough for one person. Order two or however many people there are.
author: Lilah J.

description: This place though! I'm in San Fran for the second time in a month and couldn't NOT eat here again. The vegetable pakora and vegetable samosas are incredible. I wish I could eat this everyday. A must eat and it can be delivered.
author: Nichole F.

description: Delivery was fast. The lamb vindaloo was spicy and had a lot of flavor. My only complaint was the amount of lamb. Only got as few pieces. But the flavor was awesome.  The Aloo naan was great. I'd definitely order here again.
author: Derek F.

description:
Lahore Karahi is an authentic Pakistani hole-in-the-wall nestled in The Tenderloin. 

We weren't super hungry and just felt like nibbling, which always makes for the perfect time to order kebabs!

First off, Lahore Karahi makes fresh masala chai which they keep in a thermal carafe for customers to take on their own, along with sugar on the side so that you can make your perfect cup of chai. I absolutely love it when Indian and Pakistani restaurants do this because chai truly completes the meal!

We stuck to the fundamentals and ordered Garlic Naan and the Beef Seekh Kebab. The kebab was so tender and juicy! It was grilled well and burst with subtle flavor. It was not spicy, but you can really taste the garam masala and cumin which pairs well with some lemon squeezed on top. The Garlic Naan had the right amount of thickness. All too often naan is made to be too doughy, but these guys did it well and were generous with the roasted garlic on top. 

Pro tip: Take the naan to soak up and eat the grilled onions that come with the sizzling platter that the kebabs come on. Truly divine flavors!

Would recommend this place for some authentic Pakistani food in a casual setting!
author: Sabina S.

description: This place is THE best. I order takeout almost once a week. Weekly order is onion naan and Karahi chicken.
author: Christine L.

description:
Divey Pakistani joint that makes my absolute favorite Pakistani/Indian food in the city. Fresher flavors and spicier spices that all highlight the veggies within :). 

FOOD: You can't go wrong here. 
- Saag Paneer (always)--Most saag paneer dishes I consume are drowned in cream to the point of tasting like 1) cream, 2) spice, and 3) something vaguely green. What I love about the saag here is that the fresh notes of spinach really shine through without compromising on spice at all--in fact, I think there's a more pronounced blend in Lahore's saag than in others' :). It's a healthy spice at medium. 

- Paneer Tikka Masala--Sometimes I forget tikka and other Pakistani/Indian curries have a tomato base--this dish is a great way to remember. Sweet, nutty, and rich, this is a very satisfying dish. 

- Butter naan--I love that these are round :). They are on the puffier/fluffier side of naan I've had--perhaps a product of the real deal tandoor you can see behind the counter! It's filling, replete with air bubbles, and has a lovely texture--crisp on the bottom, soft on the top, and moist in the middle. 

- Chicken and cheese stuffed naan--there is a lot going on here in a naan that could be a meal itself. The chicken came out a little dry, but was addressed by dipping in curry. This, my friend told me, is something that you can usually only find in Pakistan. Order it for the novelty or because you are Hulk-level hungry.

- Tandoori chicken--by far what most people order here. It's delicious and I appreciate the variation in portion sizes for different hunger levels.

- Mango lassi--my FAVORITE mango lassi ever. It balances exactly to my tastes the mango flavor without being too sweet and tanginess of the yogurt. It's thick, which I love. I perceive many others are blended with ice to near juice texture. Last time I went, they were closer to room temp than ice cold, which is perfect for me. 

SERVICE: Very friendly at the front counter! Order up front--if for here, pay at the end. Food is brought out to you. 

If you want it to go or to your door, Lahore Karahi is on many delivery platforms. Though I heard the front desk fellow tell someone on the phone they "don't do delivery," I've ordered delivery from Eat24 here many times. 

AMBIANCE: Very divey--chairs on a tiled floor in a one room joint that can be dusty in some nooks. It can quickly grow warm in the summer, when the heat of the tandoor fills the restaurant. 

A note for the squeamish: I saw a cockroach here once, which completely scared off my friend's appetite. When I pointed out that we had just seen a cockroach to the guy up front, he said, "Yep. It's a problem." 

I am undeterred because the food is too delicious for me to stay away. This, plus I believe the heat of cooking would eliminate any germs, and Lahore scores highest in my book for least likely for hair to end up in my food (it's never happened here; it's happened at least once from any other takeout I've ordered more than 3 times in the Bay).
author: Helen W.

description: This place is so delicious. We ordered the lamb and chicken tikka masala. It was so creamy and rich. You can eat it with a spoon, it's so good! The naan is fresh out of the oven. I have nothing but good things to say about this place. Will definitely be coming back here.
author: Lisa O.

description:
The lamb biryani here was delicious! Not too dry like some of the other ones I've tasted in the city. 

I've ordered pick a up a few times here and they are pretty fast about it.
author: Tenzin K.

description:
Not a bad place but I wasn't impressed. I might be more accustomed to more savory Indian meals but I have no gauge of how authentic anything is so I sort of just compare places to each other.

Things I noted that were different from other Indian places I've been to:

-the garlic naan was very tough to rip, not fluffy, more fried garlic than fresh garlic, and somewhat bland (tasted mostly like pita)
-the saag paneer was very watery and not heavily spiced, which made it seem pretty clean
-the tiki masala wasn't very creamy and the meat was a little dry
-the mango lassi was very mango-y and yogurt-y--almost as if they used real mangos 
-the lamb samosa had a very thin and somewhat-tough skin so i wasn't dropping crumbs with every bite (thank goodness), and the filling was very well-spiced albeit a little dry. 

Also when you come in, you order up front, seat yourself (they have water/utensils you fetch for yourself), and then pay when you're done. When I went at  7pm the service was really slow (likely due to a lack of workers) and the tea was all gone. 

Nothing here was super unique in my opinion but perhaps I needed to try more items on the menu. A-OK place
author: Lydia Z.

description: This is one of the best aloo ghobi and chicken Karahi place with chilli naan I've experienced in San Francisco area. The crown and ambience might not be the best but this rating is purely based on the taste and authenticity of the dishes ordered. Keep up the great tasting Pakistani and Indian cuisine!!
author: Moon S.

description: I was looking for a place near the hotel for good Indian food.  This place is small and unassuming.  You can sit down, look at the menu, then order at the counter.  I had the Chicken Biryani and it was really good.  Nice bit of heat and lots of chicken.  And inexpensive.  I would definitely go back and try something else.
author: Lou A.

description:
This place was a bit pricey for what it was.  I ordered a chicken curry ($10) + Garlic Naan ($3) + Rice ($2)- totaling around $17 bucks after tax.  

$17 bucks for a meal for 1 person was more than I meant to spend.  

The portion of curry was not that large.  The naan was fairly good.  The rice I wish came with the curry but it didn't.  Perhaps it's a different portion size when you take out vs eat to stay.  The food was not bad, I will give it another try to see if I'll have a better experience.
author: Justin L.

description: Looking for good cheap food to satisfy a taste of home? This is it. Don't expect a fancy place, but do expect good food! Best pakoras I've had in a while, and also has all you can eat Karak tea. Yes for me!
author: Mahsa N.

description: It's a little place with fantastic/authentic food. The place has no frills and has about six tables   Very inexpensive for the amount and quality of food. They clean the tables with Clorox so you know the tables are clean.  I highly recommend this place for adults looking for an authentic meal
author: Nina A.

description:
Ordered recently for the first time (Lamb Korma; Butter Chicken; Aloo Ghobi; Garlic Naan; Veggie Samosas; Rice). 

Loved everything, especially the Butter Chicken and Lamb Korma. Upon first glance, the meat dishes seemed somewhat "greasy" (this was mostly noticed upon hardening after refrigerating). However, be it fat or oil or whatever (and I have no issue with enjoying fat), the ingredients mixed back together wonderfully, and this was one of the tastiest places at which I've had these dishes. Flavors were bold, spicy, consistent and very well balanced. 

Can't wait to order again. Very impressed with the flavor.
author: Tommy M.

description:
Ate dinner before a show at the Great American Music Hall just a block away, and felt that it didn't live up to the Indian food standards in South Bay--primarily Sunnyvale (whaddup).

We walked in and service wasn't on point, but they did seem understaffed. There were three guys in the open kitchen working their butts off, and only one cashier. SHOUTOUT to the workers because they seemed so tired and overworked. I give them 5 stars, but the food itself wasn't anything to get excited about.

We were starving after driving up from South Bay, and got our favorite starter: samosas, two curries, and regular naan and garlic naan--our usual order. We got the aloo ghobi (potato) and eggplant curry, but both came out in such a small portion order and everything was a little too overcooked (especially the dry samosas). The place wasn't full house status, but there were other groups and tables filled besides our party of two. They do give you take-home boxes in case you can't finish your food, and it's a no frills kind of spot, just how I like my Indian food joints.

Plus: they have a clean restroom and lots of tap water in their fridge, Indian style! It's convenient and there are lots of street parking spots nearby. However, for our Friday night, it wasn't the most affordable (total came out to approx $40 for two), largest portions, or tastiest (rather, it was really dry) food.
author: Jodi H.

description:
10/10 my favorite! 

I love this place. The food is amazingly good. Complementary chai that is off the hook. Screw those street vending chai latte folk catering to corporate America's needs. Come fucking here and let your taste buds go on a trip. 

I love the curries. I forget the name of the one I specifically get, but it's a milder curry and it is amazing with some garlic naan. 

The first time I ever had this food was by pure chance. I had the opportunity to have the Aloo Gobi (probably wrong spelling), but it's a cauliflower and potatoes dish that's a little spicy but very fuckin good. One of my favorites! 

Even the rice is flavorful. 

The employees/cooks are all very nice dudes. Thy are attentive and will get your food out ASAP. Overall this place is a jem. It's in the TL and it's worth giving it a shot. 

I recommend this restaurant to errrrrbody.  

(No pictures because I demolish the food too damn fast)
author: Monica R.

description:
Favorite Indian restaurant that delivers to my home!  We randomly found this place on Amazon Prime Now when we were craving some Indian food, and after sifting through a dozen or so Indian restaurants we decided to go with Lahore Karahi.  Since then, we've tried other Indian restaurants that deliver to us, but none of them compare to Lahore Karahi!  

Every time we order from here, we get the chicken tikki masala and the butter chicken.  Both dishes are always on point, and their "extra spicy" is genuinely spicy!  At some other Indian restaurants, their extra spicy would be mild for me.  Their naans are always on point too, and we especially love the garlic naan.  Tons of garlic flavor and cooked just perfectly.  I would skip the cheese naan as there is barely any cheese in it.  Once in a while, we'll order the tandoori chicken, which always comes out moist and super flavorful.
author: William L.

description:
Food is amazing. Service can be poor. Wait time- average. I understand, they have a small kitchen and it appears, most food is made to order. However, I've been here before and every time, there is a total disregard for assisting the guest. This hurts; your guest is essentially in your home, make them feel welcomed! 

I hope that someone understands that being nice and caring for their guests means more than the quality of the food.
author: Angeline K.

description: Awesome no frills Indian spot right in the tenderloin. We had the lamb tikka masala with aloo naan and garlic naan. We fed the two of us for less than $20. The tikka masala was delicious! A lot less creamy than others I've tried and a bit more of a kick. Felt authentic. My boyfriend said the lamb was tender. I love how much flavor they pack into their naan! When they say garlic naan, oh man do they mean it. I can still taste the garlic on my breath right now lol! You order and pay at the register, seat yourself, and then they'll bring you your meal. They do take card so that's a plus.
author: Lexi R.

description:
This place is not for beginners Indian/Pakistani lol.   Definitely not the classiest establishment but well worth the sacrifice.

It might have been the only meal where I felt like I was eating in a sauna.   Sweat poured down my forehead... Not from the spice but from the hot temperatures.

No ice = not their problem, had to have my friend run across to a Bodega to buy ice cubes for our drinks.hhhmmmm. 

I guess +5 pts for being a byob place? 

Food pretty good though.   We got the fish, the saag paneer and the chicken korma.   The same sauce is sort of used through the whole menu but it was good.   The saag paneer wasn't what I was used to.   Not as much spinach. 

However, the naan was delish.   This would probably be an awesome takeout place!
author: Kimberly L.

description:
Some of the best  vindaloo I've had in ages. Super flavorful with just the right amount of spice. Raita and naan were both fully on point as well. Really can't stress how exceptional the garlic naan was. Probably the best I've had. 

This place is a total hole in the wall so don't go expecting any kind of ambiance or service. Just amazing Indian food. Can't wait to go back.
author: Joel L.

description: As the name of the restaurant is Lahore Karahi and I belong to same city Lahore :) and obviously know alot about Lahore food. This food is really quite close to the food of Lahore. And the attitude of staff and cleanliness also give you a real experience of old town of Lahore restaurant  , where taste matters nothing else matters...! And yeah same here taste is awesome not like fancy indian/paki restaurant which are good looking from outside and food taste is zero...! I have tried chicken karahi and naan. And will try more dishes in my stay hopefully.! 5/5 from myside...!
author: Zac K.

description:
Ok - yes the interior isn't the tidiest, and yes, staff don't take your order at your table. BUT the food here is delicious! 

Spicy, rich, flavorful curries - I'm a big fan of the Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, Lamb Bindi, and more recently the Aloo Keema (ground lamb & potatoes).

Their naan is best served in the restaurant - I often take it home and it gets a little soggy - and a world without their Aloo Naan (stuffed with peas & potatoes) wouldn't be a world I'd like to live in. Also, their lamb samosas, tandoori chicken, and biryanis are all must-tries.

BUT hey, let's not knock the interior of the restaurant too much: 1) they have a huge TV to watch Giants games 2) their chai is free (actually it's also free for to-go orders) 3) did I mention the TV?

Sitting on their cafeteria-like tables, watching the chai come off a fire-blackened vat and into the serving pumps, and feeling the fire blast over the stovetop curries makes me love coming to this local eatery.
author: Kevin L.

description: I came here about a week ago and it was an amazing experience I have never had indian food Soo tasty before the tables were all clean and the service was great I defently will be coming back here again
author: mag a.

description: I wouldn't say it's the best I've ever had or the worst. It was simply okay for me. Great tasting food and decent price. Service was good.
author: Dee A.

description: It's always great here. The staff treats us very well and I don't even have to order my meal anymore (they just know it): vegetable pakora, matar paneer, naan and rice. Can't ever go wrong with that!
author: Angel M.

description:
DO NOT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANT HEPATITIS OR SOME OTHER COMMUNICABLE DISEASE DUE TO THEIR UNSANITARY PRACTICES. (65/100 health inspection rating currently - do you know how much you have to f-up to get a 65/100 on a health inspection?)

This used to be my favorite cheap South Asian in the neighborhood and I hadn't noticed changes since the new owners took over (although my friends had said its quality had gone down) until my last visit - never again.  As I watched, the guy at the counter handled money, the register, and the phone and then when it was my turn to pick up my pickup order was all to happy to turn around, without washing his hands, and handle my food with his bare hands (in this case vegetable pakora which he removed from a bowl on the range, where I assume it was being held to keep it warm, and then packed it up in a paper bag).  When I called him out on it because AH HELL NO NASTY he laughed and treated it like a joke, even going to the point of finally mockingly washing his hands in the sink that is oh so conveniently located next to the register though not highly used (as if it mattered at that point).

If these owners care so little about cleanliness they have no business running a restaurant.  Shut them down!  At least I hope the city will soon as you know I complained to the health department.  Just don't take your chances here...The high rating they currently have is from reviews under the previous owners.
author: William C.

description:
Small place.. below average ambience .. from the reviews I expected the food to be good however food is sub-average compared to the other restaurants in its neighborhood on Jones street.. online menu had goat biriyani but they didn't have it . Instead ordered goat biriyani which had no flavors of biriyani. Chicken Vindaloo was just ok on taste, tandoori was average. Raita was terrible ... 
would not recommend given the huge other options near by.
author: Smartyr R.

description: In the mind of how the restaurants are in the central San Francisco area , this restaurant is great. They're great with hygiene you know they care about cleanliness. They don't work sloppy or just work to get food out and not consider the junk forming around them. Especially against the restaurant Shalimar across from them, they're way better. They're prices are higher than Shalimar but the person working there told us that he'd rather keep the prices how they are with less coming there, bringing quality service out to the customer than to make it cheap with a bad environment and horrible cleaning system. And I agree and admire them for those standards they have made for themselves. Really had a good experience. Food is classic Pakistani no complaints on that. The food coming on the table you can tell is fresh, with the amount of sizzle and smoke the food gives off. Recommend.
author: Fatima M.

description:
Food was above average but gave me tummy aches at night/the day after.

Yums:
- lamb tikka masala (lamb SO tender!! yummy!!!!)
- keema naan
- garlic naan

Meh:
- butter chicken (chicken dry/sauce not as tasty as tikka masala)
author: Nicole H.

description: Naan and chicken kababs were good. The butter chicken is eh and the vegetable curry is meh. Fast service but other than that the service is quite lacking.
author: H A.

description:
The good Yelp reviews caught my attention but the sanitation warning almost deterred me away. I'm glad it didn't, because the food here was fantastic!

The sanitation warning made me paranoid so I was initially more aware of my surroundings. As I stepped inside, nothing immediately threw me off, but I did notice that the kitchen was a bit messy and there were a few open food containers left exposed on random counter top spaces. Realistically though, this probably happens all the time in other restaurants and we just don't see it. At this restaurant, the kitchen area is exposed to the eating area so you see everything. Despite the questionable cleanliness, no one in our group got sick after eating and we all really enjoyed our meal. 

My favorite dish here is the butter chicken. I have been to several Indian restaurants (in the U.S and U.K) and can easily say that this one makes it to the top five. It was packed full of flavor and even had a subtle kick to it. I wish I can make this at home. I recommend it.

We had a vegan and vegetarian in our group and they both enjoyed their meal.

Note that everything here is self serve. You order at the counter, you pick up your own silverware, and you pour your own water. This makes it cheaper and it would be up to you to leave a tip or not. Not sure what the right tipping etiquette here is, but to me, no service means no tip.

Overall, this place is cheap and delicious. The cleanliness might throw some people off, but it wasn't enough for me not to want to come back again.
author: Danny L.

description:
Sure it's dirty and the dining area is not the cleanest, but you'll be hard pressed to find Indian/Pakistani food that's better than what they serve up at Lahore Karahi! I simply love this place! The food has great flavor, they're fast, and most importantly, you can bring your own booze! 

Be sure to get the Lamb Korma, Chicken Biriyani, and plenty of Naan. Don't let the exterior fool you, this place is legit. I've heard of people driving all the way from South Bay to get a meal here. 

Give it a try!
author: Brandon J.

description:
Free chai, generous quantities, and insanely low prices. I've brought groups of four hungry young people here and left with all of our heads spinning trying in the new reality where we're all stuffed silly and the bill comes to $45. I've brought friends from France, China, Portugal, Greece, Cameroon, Korea and all over the USA in and everyone left satisfied. Something about the open kitchen and utilitarian decor adds to the experience; it's alive with noise and spice.

The veggie options are also executed so skillfully that no veggie eater will ever feel deprived. You can't go wrong with any of the matar mushroom, bengan bharta, choley, aloo ghobi, or daal masala. The answer to every line in the menu is always Yes.

Pro tip: They allow and it seems even somewhat encourage the BYOB option, so feel free to wander in with a bottle of wine or a sixer from any of the nearby convenience stores.
author: James D.

description:
So this place is in the TL but it honestly didn't seem that bad..other than the really awkward situation of one of the servers getting into an argument with another guy and straight up shoving him out the door. He hit the ground so hard his beanie came off, and that's how you know it's some real shit. BUT the food is legit so I think it's worth it to come back.

Between the four of us we ordered the chicken curry, lamb korma, paneer tikka masala,  chicken boti tikka, and then two sides of rice, two cheese naans, one garlic naan, and one garlic and cheese naan (which isn't on the menu but you can ask for). When they come out, the bowls are pretty small but don't be fooled, the portions are ridiculously filling. Two sides of rice was more than enough to leave our bellies extremely full. The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!). The only thing I would say is that the chicken boti tikka was a little dry, but honestly that's just me trying to find something wrong with it. I was so unbelievably happy with this food and wished I could make my stomach bigger to eat more of it. Ughhh drooling just thinking about it now.
author: Sam L.

description: Incredible food without any fluff to the place. I will definitely come back and would highly recommend. The tandoori chicken was spiced in a most delicious way. The lamb korma was super tasty the lamb cooked well. The garlic naan was also great, and a mango lassi finished off the meal (definitely bit through the spiciness of the chicken).
author: Ruby H.

description:
Mmmm..my favorite Indian/Pakistani  joint! :) Their curries are oh. so. goood...
Out of all the Indian/Pakistani places in the Tenderloin, this place is seriously the best!

I tried the Chicken Korma curry for the first time and omg.. it was soooo good. Buttery goodness. drools... goes perfectly well with garlic naan. 
The Goat Curry is also one of my favorites. Super authentic!
Mango lassi is also a must! Not tangy and very yogurt-y :)
author: Leilani Y.

description: I can come to this place everyday and never get tired of it. The lamb Qorma is the best Qorma I had in my entire life. The sizzling Kababs that they bring sizzling on the plate is the most beautiful thing you will see on food and just imagine eating it!!! Amazing friendly guys!!
author: Rich M.

description: This review is for delivery only. I ordered butter chicken , nann and raita. The raita was completely spilled in the bag all over everything. Fine. It happens. The butter chicken though! Orange water!! I have never received something so inedible! I do not know how this place has such good reviews. The entire order went into the trash. When I complained they said I had to return the delivery order to them myself. In the tenderloin. Great , let me grab an Uber to return this mess. Thanks. I can get past the spill, but the food was disgusting.
author: Kate P.

description:
3.5 stars. 

If I knew about the poor safety score on Yelp, I would have stopped my boyfriend from ordering takeout from this place on EAT24.  Whatever we received though was pretty good.  Garlic naan was solid, lamb and goat curry rocked it.  The tandoori chicken was a little too dry for my taste and so was their roti.  Ok, must name drop again that this place pales in comparison to Shalimar, but it's actually the second best place I've had Indian/Pakistani food so far in the City.  Maybe I haven't tried enough Indian/Pakistani places yet then.  Close, but no cigar.
author: Bailey N.

description: Idk how this place has so many good reviews. Our server seemed nice but we were never offered any water. The food was mediocre and I'm pretty sure we got up-charged, regret not speaking up when we got rang out (got charged almost $40 for chicken korma and butter chicken). The pictures of this place are deceiving it's basically a hole in the wall but without tasty food. there was this taco place across the street that looked busy I regret not going there instead.
author: Samantha N.

description: Good service. One star is because all the Curry's have same taste. Chicken Karahi has white curry and was sweet. Karahi should not have curry and sweet.
author: Farhan K.

description: I'm amazed at the positive reviews. We just got delivery. Raita is no more than colored water. Chicken tikka and butter chicken taste identical - neither great. Saag paneer watery and flavorless.
author: David W.

description:
Great Indian food! We had garlic naan and regular naan, goat curry, sag paneer, tandoori chicken.
Everything tasty REALLY good! Chicken was tender, goat was well cook and the naan... all yeah the naan, pretty bomb!
I highly recommend this place! 
Only negative which is the reason why I removed one star: they have a safety health warning which popped up on their yelp page so I really hope I won't be sick tomorrow :/
author: Rachida I.

description:
Interesting Indian food. Very good flavor. I find it interesting how generous they are with the cilantro in their Korma sauce.

My boyfriend and I shared the garlic naan, lamb korma, and lamb curry. All were great. The dishes were a little on the oily side, but not overly so. The food did not make us sick.

If In the area, I would definitely come back. 

Tip: here you order food at the counter, sit down, eat, then pay your bill. A bit different than most restaurants.
author: Amanda R.

description: Ordered daal, goat curry, garlic naan, plain naan, rice and raita. Everything was tasteless! The goat curry was super oily and the lentils weren't cooked all the way. Both naans were super chewy and had no flavor. And a small box of rice was $3!!! Waste of money and a chew.
author: J S.

description: I ordered food from here online. The chicken tikka masala gravy was watery and not spicy at all in spite of selecting spice level. The chicken biryani was decent; it could have more flavor though...The garlic naan was super thick...Overall, the food tasted just okay.
author: Tejashree M.

description: Very delicious food and a warm environment. I'm a vegetarian but my family is not. We all enjoyed our food. I got the Mango Lassi, Vegetable Samosa, Vegetable Korma and I enjoyed all. The Mango Lassi is very good. The Vegetable Korma is a mild curry but you can ask to make it spicy. They ask what percent spicy you want it, if you want it spicy. The drinks you grab yourself if you want water, tea, canned soda, but the Mango Lassi is on the menu. There are a lot of vegetarian choices as well as meat choices and seafood.
author: Apolline B.

description: The best little hole-in-the-wall place in the Tenderloin. We've been ordering takeout from here for years and it's DELICIOUS. Highly recommend the chana saag and the veggie korma. Rice isn't included, so if you want it, order it separately. So good!
author: Amy H.

description:
If delicious food is your priority, this is the place for you. Location can be daunting and decor is frugal, but the food is so flavorful, fresh and served direct from heat to your table.
No liquor license, but allow byob which is easily obtainable across the street.
author: catherine h.

description: They have very tasty chicken tikka. I ordered them extra spicy and that was a very tasty dish. They make their own bread in tandoorii and it is also delicious. Good value for money
author: Fikret D.

description:
Food is good but you could end up waiting well over  35 mins for just one dish without being told that it could take that long and it's definitely not worth that much of a wait. Also, this is second time I'm here and they don't have roti and I had to get Naan.

I ordered Chana saag and when the food came after 35 mins it was Daal saag and the server told me while putting food on the table that they ran out of chana. 

Cleanliness and ambiance is below average. 

Won't be coming back again.
author: Nitesh A.

description:
I tried this place on a whim since the only other Indian places I like in the neighborhood are either a bit of a walk or not that great. Definitely glad I tried this place. 

I ordered take out chicken vindaloo, some garlic naan, and a side of rice since the main dish didn't actually come with it. It was a huge amount of delicious food, and I will definitely be ordering again, although probably without as many carbs!

Also just has a really great, chill location. Really convenient, and even while sitting there for a minute before grabbing my takeout, I appreciated how understated the vibe was. Thinking next time I might do sit down to see how chill it is that way. 

Regardless, if you're looking for a reasonably priced, delicious Indian restaurant in the Tenderloin, look no further.
author: Michael Z.

description: They serve awesome Naan. We ordered onion naan and paneer tikka masala and it was just awesome. This place has good options for vegetarians. Don't miss Naan at this place. They have complimentary chai as well. Love this place, will definitely come back for Naan
author: Arati S.

description: This place is BYOB which makes it a routine staple for my friends and I! Staff is friendly and welcoming, too. Ask for garlic cheese naan and the saag paneer
author: Delaney C.

description: In town for a business trip.  Went here on a friend's suggestion. Great food with the right spice level, LOVE the byob policy. Very authentic
author: Mithila P.

description: Placing this eview while sitting in the resturant. This is  We ordered chicken biriyani, butter chicken and naan. The chicken biriyani taste like fish curry mixed with chicken in it. Wrost biriyani i ever had.  Butter chicken and naan was good.
author: Tanver M.

description: Naans were outstanding! Biryani was one of the best in the bay. Chicken Karahi was solid. Looking forward to trying their other options. I think my personal favorite was the aloo and Keema naan.
author: Matthew M.

description: Very good! Got the recommendation from a friend, I have passed it so many times. Had the chance to try it out and I was quite satisfied.
author: Adam T.

description:
Came in on a boiling, humid day & there was absolutely no ventilation whatsoever. My first impression when I stepped in was that this place was not sanitary at all. I was 100% right because I saw bugs, more specifically coach roaches, crawling on the walls when I was waiting for my food, which btw was a 30-45 minute wait. My friends & I decided to give this place the benefit of the doubt & tried to focus on the food.

FOOD: The food here is great. The downside is obviously the cleanliness which made me not enjoy the food all that much. I got the veggie curry with potatoes & cauliflower & garlic naan. The naan hit the spot! 

CUSTOMER SERVICE: There was nothing special about the customer service. They did not greet us when we walked through the door and the water is self served, as in everyone in the little restaurant shares one bucket of water. Strange. 
 
Overall, come here if you want some authentic Indian food, but stay away if you're looking for a nice setting, good customer service, and a sanitary area.
author: Phuong H.

description:
I was tired, hungry and maybe just a little hung over. So what was I craving? Deliciously comforting Indian food! Decided to pick up take out from Lahore Karahi for lunch.

*Vegetable samosa: two crispy puffs filled with potatoes, green peas ($3.99)
The samosas were a good size and crispy. The only disappointing thing? They didn't give me any mint dipping sauce. So I didn't get that refreshing mint contrast.

*Chicken tikka masala: barbecued boneless chicken sauteed with herbs and spices ($9.99)
Nice flavor with a subtle spice. I usually like my curry thick, so this was a little on the runny side for me. It didn't really coat the naan when I dipped it in the curry.

*Garlic naan: naan stuffed with garlic ($2.75)
Huge! The naan was actually the favorite part of my meal. Soft with a nice chew. And some good garlic flavor.

This could have easily been a 4 star review if they didn't forget the mint dipping sauce and the curry was thicker. But alas, those two misses made this a 3 star review. But the good thing about getting Indian for lunch? I can also have it for dinner. I had enough leftovers for two more meals!
author: Elena N.

description: The most nostalgic food ever. Growing up in Dubai, we have some of the best indo paki food, however, after living in Cali and now AZ, I've had a hard time finding good authentic Pakistani food. I was sooo happy to have stumbled upon this hole in the wall on my recent trip to SF. The food is delicious, authentic, made right when you order it and the taste of the food just reminded me of being back home. Such a great food experience.
author: Mona A.

description:
Hole in the wall kind of place. Ordered Lamb Vandaloo and Naan to go. Naan is very thick, so one was plenty, I shared the second one with our neighborhood homeless guy. 

Lamb vandaloo was tasty. I will explore more Indian places nearby and will pick my favorite, hopefully soon.
author: Anelya S.

description:
The Tenderloin has quickly become one of my favorite places for food. Although this place gets a bad rap about it's neighborhood, the truth is, it's an awesome foodie destination. You literally have every cuisine at your fingertips and lots of options. One in particular is Indian food. On a special night with my special someone, we decided to come to this place because he mentioned how great this food was. I couldn't resist!

This place is definitely a hole in the wall. Don't ever judge a book by it's cover though. Once you walk in, you approach the counter, order your food and choose a table to sit at. After the meal is done, you pay up front. The staff is super nice and friendly. They actually gave some good recommendations that helped us determine our meal. Here's what we had:

-Cheese nan for $2.75. The nan is a flat bread served with the food, helps to mop up the delicious broth. This nan was topped with melted cheese and really came out hot! So good!

- Lamb Biryani for $10.99. Lamb cooked in hot spicy herbs and tossed in with saffron rice like fried rice. It was sooooo delicious! The lamb was tender and flavored well. The saffron rice brought a light tang and really came packed with flavor. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS DISH!

-Lamb Korma for $10.99. Lamb cooked in creamy gravy with herbs and spices. I LOVED this dish as well. The creamy gravy was made at a nice thick consistency. The lamb was also cooked well and super tender. Drizzle this dish over rice and you've got the best combination. OH-EM-GEE!

Listen, this place is one of the best Indian joints I've tried in a long time. You need to get your butt up the hill on Leavenworth and try this place out. You will NOT be disappointed. In fact, you'll be coming back for more!
author: Rockne H.

description:
Really wanted kabobs and found this place on yelp. 

Walked in here at 12:30pm (I was the only customer), looked at the menu for a bit, stood up and walked to the front to make my order, waited for a solid 2 minutes for the staff to notice me and come over, ordered a chicken kebab with a side of rice, sat back down, and waited about 30min for food. 

After getting my food, the cook came over and asked me if I wanted any sauce. He then went and made me some tikka sauce on the house! Really [really really really really really] good! I'm no expert on Indian food but this place makes my top 3. 

Come here if you have time to spare as the food is made to order. The place was a bit grimy looking and a couple homeless folks trickled in here and there and dipped their fingers in some leftover sauce from some tables that had not been cleared. The staff didn't seem to mind. That warmed my heart. 

Note that there were only 2 people working here, the cook whom I assume is the owner and another man who does everything else.
author: Anna H.

description: Friendly, authentic, and reasonable neighborhood food joint with a tiny, open kitchen so you can see your food being prepared. Be warned, if you go in and sit down, you will smell like the food after you leave. I love that about places like this, but not everyone does.
author: Megan W.

description:
Lahore Karahi is my happy place.

After a few cocktails from Rye, a group of us headed to Lahore Karahi hoping to find some awesome, hole-in-wall style Indian food. This is the real deal.

We went all in, talking saag paneer, lamb tikka masala, naan, pakoras, samosas, mutter paneer, chicken vindaloo, lamb curry, and maybe one more. It's hard to remember in a blur of curry what I had, I just know I had more food than I think I've ever eaten in my entire life. Seriously.

The spot is very unassuming, and you can see the big pots and pans cooking up the deliciousness right as you order. We confirmed that we could bring in our own beer so made a quick pit stop and brought them in as we waited. 

This was an all timer, an epic meal. This is the type of meal where I set my fork down saying I'm done only to pick it up about five more times. 

Find this place, go to this place and find your happy place.
author: Adam S.

description:
Coming from India and living in central part of USA. This is my 1st time visit to the bay area. I was totallky shocked by seeing the number of reviews about each restaurant here.
I went here for lunch one day and grabbed to go finally as I felt the place is not so big and spacious. It is reasonably priced but I didnot get that biryani flavour. I felt rather like fried rice than biryani. I was totally disappointed with the taste too.
author: Bhanu H.

description: I think they do a great goat curry! and the Biryani is good. I go there sometimes just for the goat curry - very "tasteful".
author: Babar Y.

description: The taste and ambiance of this restaurant can't be beat. It is popular for a reason and this restaurant is the best reason to come to this neighborhood. In terms of service these guys are as sloppy as the wet kisses you get from your dog after you come home from a long vacation. Sure I get it sometimes they are so busy and overworked because of their popularity but still I wonder if there is disorganization or some sort of lack of communication somewhere inside the kitchen or bottleneck that could be solved?
author: Stefan T.

description: Hole in a wall kind of place. I was excited to go-to this place based on the reviews it had but I was disappointed with the food quality and ambience. I tried vegetarian menu. The food is poor to average in quality and taste. It's super cheap in terms of prices. That might explain the good reviews.
author: Rakesh G.

description: Tried biryani. Was edible. Quite bland and flavorless, other than salt and red chilli powder. Chicken was nicely cooked and tender, hence a star.
author: Ruby V.

description:
When I think of Christmas dinner I don't think of Indian food and I certainly don't think of eating it in the Tenderloin. But now, after this year these things will always be just one degree of separation for me.

We came here for Christmas eve. It was pretty busy around 8pm. You order up front, seat yourself, and pay at the end when you're finished with your meal. 

The unique thing about Lahore Karahi is all the self service which I've never really had experience with. There is unlimited hot chai tea, wine glasses, water jugs in the refrigerator all DIY. I actually kinda liked it, you don't have to wait around for a server for simple requests at this casual dining spot. 

The food did take kind of long to come but I think the kitchen is small and everything is so fresh, it takes a bit and it's definitely worth the wait. I suppose don't come when you're in a rush and want to be in and out quickly. 

We started off with an order of samosa. It's REALLY simple. Not too many spices, no peas. This is a very basic samosa that gets the job done. I needed some extra salt. Their tamarind sauce is a bit too watery, but the flavor is still good. The cilantro/mint one was spot on. For the main meal, my partner ordered the chicken boti tikka. This was fantastic -- 4 huge pieces of tender and moist chicken in a beautiful bright red color and sauteed onions with lime on a skillet. It doesn't come with a sauce for dipping if you get naan, so be mindful of that. 

I ordered the chicken tikka masala which I really did enjoy, but the flavors are little bit muted compared to a great chicken tikka. Still though, with the naan and gravy I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. I have to say the naan at Lahore Karahi is off the charts. I might even go so far as to say this is the one of the best, if not the best naan I've ever had. It was super fresh, sooooo soft and chewy and delicious. They have so many kinds of naan, so next time I going to try one of the different flavors -- sesame naan, cheese naan, aloo paratha, Afghani naan, etc.  

We will definitely be back even if it's just for the naan.
author: Priti K.

description: The food was good but the services sucked! These guys need to be retrained for customer service
author: Issa A.

description:
Despite the place being a complete hole-in-the-wall in TL, I find myself coming back (and recently, ordering from UberEats!) because the food is just toooo good! Despite the low food safety score... which didn't scare me away, and it hasn't gotten me sick yet (knock on wood). I love the garlic naan, and I feel like their naan is bigger than what other restaurants give. The butter chicken is also one of the best I've had, mostly due to the tenderness of the chicken. Most chicken curries at other places are dry, so I was surprised that they cooked the chicken so well here! I also get the paneer tikka masala which is delicious, though I think I might like the butter chicken sauce better than the tikka masala (though they only offer paneer tikka masala, not paneer makhani, afaik).

If you can look past its slightly sketch location and the low food safety score, this is an Indian place you cannot skip! Might be my favorite Indian place in the city.
author: Grace D.

description:
My friend and I sat there for a good 5 minutes wondering how come no waiter wants to take our order. Then we looked up and realized you order at the counter. Duhhhh.
 
Lots of amazing Indian places in San Francisco.. this one.. not so much. We had the lamb tikka masala and vegetable pakoras. Both were ehhh. The vegetable pakoras didn't have much flavor, I had to drench it in sauce to make it more edible. Whatever the green sauce they gave us was bomb though. Never seen green sauces in Indian food either. I really liked it though! The tikka masala was lacking flavor too, which is just whaaaaat (?!?!?!) for Indian curry. It tastes slightly bland if that's even possible. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing either. It was just eh. A 3/5.
 
But the reason why I'm giving this place 2 stars is because THERE WAS A CREATURE CRAWLING ALONG THE WALLS. I'm not sure what it was but it looked like a baby cockroach or something very similar. I understand this isn't a fancy restaurant but creatures are NEVER okay. I felt so grossed out for the rest of my meal. Not a feeling I enjoy when I'm trying to grub :|
author: Angel C.

description:
I don't give a F@&$ about some health inspection score.  I've traveled the world eating great food at places that would make this place seem like a 5 star restaurant. I decided to try this place b/c I walk by it all the time and the smell of Indian spices and garlic and such coming out of the place is intoxicating. This place is the best Indian I've had in SF hands down and it's a dive too!

They have this take on mutter paneer called shahi paneer.  They fry the cheese and then add it to the sauce.  The cheese eventually melts into the sauce if you stir it up a bit.  Essentially a cheezy tomato-y curry dip. OMFG!

And the Garlic naan is the best I've had in SF.  Get over the looks of the place.  Never judge a book by it's cover!  Try some good Indian.  The Tenderlion has a lot of good places to eat!
author: Oliver S.

description:
Great spot to grab very tasty Indian/Pakistani food with a group. It's very low key - order at the counter, seat yourself, etc., and it's BYOB. Few things to note: 

-Samosas were delicious, definitely throw some of that mint sauce all over those things
-We went with a bunch of vegetarians and they were very pleased
-Contrary to some other reviews, I thought the garlic naan was delicious and wish we had gotten more
author: Luke H.

description:
I love Indian food and I've been wanting to come to Lahore Karahi for ages now - it's a small ghetto Indian restaurant in the tenderloin. Not super convenient and a little scary to walk to at night. 

When you walk in, pick up a plastic covered menu and sit anywhere. I smashed a large insect crawling on the table with my menu - how multi-functional. You order at the cash register, and I *loved* that you could modify the ingredients (I got ghobi aloo without the potatoes). They have Square and can split checks, woohoo for credit cards. 

All in all, solid Indian food and will be coming back again soon for the tandoori fish! For $40 total before tip, this was enough food for 2 girls with a little leftover for lunch for one the next day.

* TANDOORI FISH ($11.99) - 5 STARS: 
Grilled tilapia (claimed to be strictly grilled, not battered) crispy and salty on the outside, but tender on the inside, served on a sizzling plate. While this could be considered on the expensive side, it included ~5 small filets - not a bad deal!

* CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA ($8.99) - 3 STARS:
I've never been a huge fan of tikka masala because the sauce is too creamy and the chicken is usually too dry. This did not break any stereotypes for me, and the portion of chicken was meager.

* ALOO GHOBI ($7.99) - 4 STARS:
Pretty standard but what makes this dish extra special is that you can order it without the potatoes which to me is such a filler ingredient I don't need to have.

* BINDI MASALA ($7.99) - 4 STARS:
Again, pretty standard okra dish but I loved that it was chock full of okra rather than fill ingredients like peas, onions and potatoes.
author: Jess C.

description: Basic ambience that packs a punch of flavor. They had a great TCM, tandoori kabobs were okay. I'm not gonna expect one restaurant to be amazing at everything. For the dishes they're good at, they are very good!
author: Nabeel C.

description: Although there's quite a few Indian restaurants in the downtown area, Lahore Karahi is my go to spot for great Indian food. You can never go wrong with the Chicken Tikka Masala with rice & naan. So delicious! It's also a bit cheaper than the nearby competitors, making it a no-brainer.
author: Andrew C.

description: Used to be the best Biriyani in town , when Guddu used to run the place.
author: Badhri S.

description: Not the best place for Indian food at all. Starting off with the ambience - it's in the middle of tenderloin and to add to that the interiors aren't that great. The kitchen is open so all the heat comes into the dining space and there's no proper air conditioning. Coming to the food - I could taste more oil than the actual flavours of the curry. The only saving grace was the butter naan. I would much rather walk over to shalimar which is only a few steps away.
author: Akshat G.

description:
Disappointed about the quality of curries and raita.
I expected more since the smell from the restaurant reminds me of Pakistan where I visited many times. We ordered chicken karahi and aloo gobee (potato and cauliflower). These tasted ok but not superb.
Maybe I expected too much.
author: Akihiro I.

description: This is one of our go to restaurants in the neighborhood. Staff is really friendly and everything we have tried has been consistently great. Also their chai is amazing and flavorful, plus is complementary when you eat there. Be careful because it is strong!
author: Nicole C.

description: While it's only my fault for going back since it's directly across the street from my apartment, when Guddo owned/ran this place it was truly non pareil. Nobody could complete. All the other Pakistani restaurants in the neighborhood are fine but Lahore Karahi stood head and shoulders above them. Guddo's recipes were like none other. Whoever bought him out truly stinks and I would urge you not to go there. Unfortunately nobody truly measures up to his style of cooking but trust me; this is now the worst choice in the neighborhood. It pains me to pan any local business but they need to up their game significantly.
author: Sean F.

description:
Was really weirded out by the place...(review is from July)

I ordered food from here and picked it up.  1. I was upset because they gave me a completely different dal than what I ordered online (because they "ran out.").  Luckily, I checked my order before leaving and when I asked a person there, he said they ran out but they just got more - a guy in a car brought a big tub of the dal, among other items, so the person speaking to me was willing to warm it up and give it to me...I took it but the whole concept that they don't even make their own dal was weird and kinda gross that it was brought by someone else in a random car.  I made dietary requests (less cream, less paneeretc.) and I'm pretty sure none of that was followed, especially with the dal.  

The food tasted okay and the saag paneer was okay, too...nothing special.  Service wasn't bad but why not let  me know they didn't have the dal to begin with? Would not come back here...
author: Monica J.

description: Very casual place but AMAZING food. If you are looking for a good Indian food this is the place to go! When we walked it didn't look liked we would like their food and took a little while to get ready, but it was worth the a little wait :D
author: Ellie T.

description: I had the butter chicken and plain naan. Omg!  I've had a lot of butter chicken in my days and this may have been the best. It's a bit spicy - my lips are still burning. The bread was amazing. I had good customer service - not sure what others have experienced. I'll definitely be back.
author: Jeff P.

description: Honestly, the best and most authentic Indian food I have ever had! It's amazing! Very well priced and so good. Great variety, consistent quality, overall the best Indian food experience I have ever had. It's my go to place, no question. Also BYOB is a win!
author: Nicolas C.

description: Was a good place to eat if you looking for good inexpensive food . Mostly popular for take out . The owners could work on ambience and food presentation. There was a small fire when I was there ventilation was bad as only one door functioning.
author: Manoj S.

description:
This place is DOPE! From start to finish, absolute greatness was delivered to our table. The Lamb Samosa appetizer was great. The Vegetable Korma and Chicken Makhani were hits. In general, the food had a bit of kick to it, but it was never too spicy. The Mango and Cashew Indian Ice Cream sealed the deal on our great meal. 

I can't believe I'm saying this, given the somewhat shady neighborhood, but I actually want to come back!
author: Mark C.

description: Don't know why the review the so high and why so many people wrote reviews. We ordered samosa, tikka masala, garlic nang. I would say the taste is okay, though nang is nice.
author: Gwen C.

description: Finally got to try this place today.  Did not disappoint.  Got the saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, aloo gohbi, garlic naan and rice.  Portions are not huge, but perfect for sharing.  Saag paneer was exceptional.  Everything else was fresh and flavorful.  Good hospitality and reasonably priced.  Would definitely go back to try more!
author: Julie P.

description: Easily my favorite Indian food in SF! I absolutely love this place and recommend dining-in at this charming, delicious, BYOB hole-in-the-wall. Despite the no-drills ambience, Lahore feels like an intimate oasis at the border of San Francisco's tenderloin. Try the lamb vindaloo, the saag paneer, and the chicken tikka masala (get it spicey!). Bring an IPA and come hungry.
author: Casey C.

description: This place was incredible! We were exploring San Fran during a long layover and my family enjoyed this place so much! We drive around all the key attractions and the location was great. The people were super nice, the place had authentic food, and whoever made the Naans deserves an award! They stayed soft the entire time, even a day later the food was so good! Get the chicken tikka masala and some garlic naan, you'll love it! 100% recommend!
author: Rija A.

description:
Been meaning to write this for ages...  Ever since Guddu sold this place, it's gone downhill.  I miss Guddu's cooking, that big smile, and his love of food.  His cooking is hands down the best I've ever tasted in 20 years of indo/pak food.
I hear that Guddu is starting back up with doing delivery in SF.  Super excited to see him again and have some of his food.
Don't waste your time on this place.  It's not worth it.  They're surviving on Guddu's past reviews, not the food they make.
author: Shaun K.

description: I didn't tried everything there but I did eat lots of food. My favorite dish is tandoori fish, bhindi masala and aloo gobi. Generally good food.
author: Simbel G.

description: One of the best Indian restaurants in all of the Bay Area. Attention to detail is focused on at this establishment, especially the flavor palette for each individual dish. A definite must try for anyone who is craving high quality, incredibly flavorful, authentic Indian cuisine.
author: Sean F.

description:
One of the best Indian restaurants I've ever ate! the food is very fresh and tasty!
This spot is a great mix of colors smells and spices! highly recommend
author: Michael J.

description:
I ordered take-out from this place at the recommendation of an India neighbor, for the sake of variety (vs my usual go-to place, nearby Shalimar). 

First couple of bites were okay but overall wasn't more satisfied than my usual go-to place.

For starters, their orders cost more than my usual place, in one case double the cost for the same portion size (saag chicken). The tandoori chicken was fine but by the end of our meal we found both chicken dishes to be on the dry side.

The basmati rice was nothing special and we could have made it at home. 

Overall the meal was initially tasteful and generally fine, but am going to stick to my other neighborhood Indian place in part based on cost (and some loyalty).
author: D L.

description: Best Indian food I've ever had I come here every other day with my gf and it never gets old . Try the daal saag it's amazing
author: Jbl H.

description:
On the walk over here some drifter chick asked if I wanted some powder (cocaine) gh.

Didn't realize tenderloin was where lots of drifters/street types/crackheads congregate. 

"Haha no thank you." Otherwise, I wanted to feel high on some Indian food so I stumble upon this bare-bones, gritty establishment with cold pitchers of water in the fridge, cash preferred payment options, and quaint interior. 

Go for the chicken biryani. That jaunt is spicy and I'm white so I'm glad they did that to me (gave me spicy food). It's about $12 for a big plate of this seasoned chicken and rice. They're a little skimpy with the chicken. Otherwise, I'm in love.
author: Jerry B.

description:
Any time you try out a new place with the rule of thumb, by order one of the old stand by. For Pakistan/Indian restaurants is palak paneer, cheese and spinach. I'm a twelve years customer of another institution near by, and I compare the taste. The second rule is do they have their own ethnic customers ? And even 

bring their whole family? 3rd is their basis staple of bread, naan is $1.75 vs $1.00 at near by establishment, which also is fresh out of the oven. 4th: don't believe the myth of words of mouth or long waiting lines by hipsters, who came from nowhere, any taste is a adventure to the inexperienced. This place just no hurry to refill the chai, which is customary free with meal. .....you be the judge !
author: Abel Y.

description: after all these years, i finally tried this place.  i wasn't super hungry when i came, but i had a samosa and the aloo gobi, which is my go-to at indian restaurants.  the samosa was piping fresh and HOT.  i like the cilantro chutney that was at the table, that you can eat it with.  the gobi was a bit over cooked, but the flavors were light and not too greasy.  service here is friendly and everything seems made to order.  there's also free chai at the water station.
author: Helen T.

description: After reading most the positive ratings, I decide to take a chance and try this place.  Man, do I regret it.  I ordered dinner to go.  The naan was like chewing on leather.  The tandoori chicken was very dry, and charred to a crisp in some areas.  Taste on the uncharred areas were ok.  Ordered the okra which have oil oozing out of the container.  The chicken kebab was dry and tasted mediocre.   Lentil curry was bland.  Fish vindoloo and plain  Basmati rice were the only dish I deem edible.
author: Ayn K.

description: This is probably the best Indian food, I had in a very long time... It's a very small place, ambience is not that great, but their awesome food beats it all.. We ordered chicken boti kebab and chicken biryani and both were just awesome... The bill for this came up to $23...Will definitely come here again and again... This is all coming from a very satisfied tummy and customer
author: Harshita S.

description: Great Indian place in the Tenderloin of SF. Free chai and really good tikka masala - not too sweet like most others. Not much seating and not the best neighborhood. I really like the food here, but strange service. Sort of half self-service like many Indian places. I felt like I was ordering from the chef who was busy cooking as he took my order, than I wasn't sure who to talk to about adding/changing things. And equal confusion when it was time to pay. But regardless of the service, very good food.
author: Peter K.

description: The food was very good. However, I could tell a lot of dye was used in the sauce and the drinks because my hands as well as my colleagues hands had quite a bit of orange staining after lunch. It was delicious though. Getting there is an experience of its own. You have to go through a really rough part of the city to get here. I would say the food was worth the adventure of walking through large amounts of  homeless people and a bit of criminal activity, during the day only though..
author: Sd R.

description:
Dear Lahore Karahi, it's been just over a week and all I can think about is how rich, flavourful, and plentiful your food was! I miss you. With love, Ayla C.

This place came highly recommended by Don B. so our little group happily made our way over. It looks very unassuming as you step inside, a little counter with multiple burners cooking up a storm behind it, and a selection of cafeteria-esque tables. We grabbed one big enough for the six of us and quickly made our choices.

We ordered samosas and pakora to start, which were quickly demolished in a flurry of flavourful, spiced glee. We had so many curries to share; they all arrived in small bowls which looked like there wouldn't be enough to go around between the six of us - believe me, I was wrong. So, so wrong. 

We had everything you could think of - saag paneer, chicken vindaloo, lamb curry, mutter paneer (always my favourite), and at least two more. Each curry delighted us with it's well-balanced spices, rich creaminess, and big flavour. We complemented the curries with two giant plates of fluffy rice and three types of naan - one stuffed, one regular, and one garlic (obviously). The naan were soft and perfectly cooked, with just a little crisp from the Tandoor.

If I lived in SF I know I'd consume A LOT of food from here. It's cheap, huge portions, and insanely delicious. My only complaint is that it was so good I ate everything and I was still full the next morning! How dare you be so delicious!
author: Ayla C.

description: The garlic naan was incredible! Very thick and soft and super fresh. The masala was good, I ordered spicy and it was a little under the spicy I prefer and small portions but over all great to go food!
author: Jada M.

description:
After reading such great reviews and wanting to try a new Indian place out that is close to home, we decided to ditch our usual Shalimar and come here instead.

Lahore Karahi tries to be modern and user friendly, by offering online ordering through their website as well as through Eat24.
Bad thing is that the prices are different on every site I go to. Of course, the more expensive menu prices you see are what is currently the price they sell for.
It is $9 a dish now, which is very expensive for Indian cuisine...

They have an extensive vegetarian menu, which is nice. But the flavors are lacking here and the consistency very watery. I tried the dal Masala and their Chana Masala. 
The Roti and Naan breads are chewy, not crisp, and hard to swallow. It also wasn't piping hot when we got it, which made it seem like it's been sitting out for a while.

The rice was tough and some was already dry and hard. 

We ordered at 6:30pm, so we don't understand why they wouldn't have fresh bread and rice to offer.

It's all too bad. But the quality of the food here just wasn't enough to bring me back, especially with the constantly rising and contradicting prices!
author: Lanie L.

description:
Good food.

Not cheap -- but, still I find it a good value.

Free CHAI

The place seems clean. ;)
author: BigJohnS F.
