description: This was by far the worst Indian dining experience my girlfriend and I have ever came across. How do you mess up tikka masala!!!? Super bland food. If I could I would give 0/5. Disappointing
author: Evan R.

description:
lahore karahi has been on my list for a while, but since they dont deliver and is in a sketchier part of town, i've been holding off on trying. since the parents are in town though, and were shopping downtown, we decided to stop in because authentic indian food is hard to come by in shanghai...

the restaurant is very minimal and simple - everything is self serve (though they brought us plates and utensils (maybe we looked a bit lost).  we order so many things for 3 people - half a tandoori chicken, shrimp briyani, saag paneer, fish tikka masala, veg tikka masala, cheese naan and garlic naan. haah SUCH FATTIES. 

food came out reasonably fast and all of a sudden our table was full.  the naans were really thin and crispy, and the cheese one was delicious with the tikka sauce.  saag paneer was a bit underwhelming, not as liquidity as i usually like my saag. briyani had good flavors, but not a lot of shrimp.  my mom really enjoyed the tandoori chicken, and here was a good amount of it!  i thought the tikka was flavorful, but....missing SOMETHING.  dinner after tax & tip was $75 - a bargain for all this food (we had a bit of leftovers for my lunch the next day).  i probably wont be coming back given the location...and lack of memorable-ness.
author: Christina L.

description: Ordered tandoori chicken leg, goat curry and garlic naan. The goat is well cooked and tandoori is perfect. Naan is decent. Would order food here again.
author: Ravi Teja P.

description: We have been here several times and the food has been decent. Today we ordered kabob and it was not cooked well. The sizzler platter was not sizzling!!! Naan is still good. A Pakistani restaurant with all non Pakistani/desi chefs!! For real. This will be my last trip to this establishment.
author: Mahmood H.

description: The best Indian food I've had in San Francisco, and probably in the US. We tried the naan, butter chicken, and lamb in mild cream curry. All three were full of flavor, moist, and great texture.
author: Sasquatch M.

description:
Absolutely incredible Indian food--the quality of the chicken/meat dishes would compare with any 5 star restaurant.  The vegetarian dishes are very good, but not as good as the meat/chicken entrees.  Chai is complimentary, which is always nice.  

The food is cooked in a small, open kitchen.  Eating here feels like a soon-to-be famous chef has come to your grungy home and decided to make you the best meal of your life.  Some people think the restaurant's location in the seedier Tenderloin district is a drawback, but I think it provides character.  

Overall, this is one of the best Indian/Pakistani restaurants anywhere, especially considering its very reasonable prices.
author: Matt R.

description: To me it was good, nothing amazingly special. Although I have only ate Indian food one time prior so I am not a good judge on how good it was, I just know I enjoyed it. The employees were very nice and food was quick. The neighborhood is not great, but go in the day it's not that bad.
author: Cynthia G.

description: The food was decent. Lot greasy, and heavy. They provide no silverware for take outs or orders from Yelp eats 24
author: Mahesh M.

description: Great food. I always order take out because I live nearby. Interior is about what you would expect from a downtown shop like this. Go for the food. Not for the atmosphere. You won't be disappointed.
author: Jonathan G.

description: Finally got to check out this place after hearing so many positive reviews. Got a table easily on a Monday evening. Similar to Pakwan in Mission where you grab your own water, sauces, etc. We got the following dishes and I recommend them all: garlic naan, lamb naan, bengan bharta, saag paneer, lamb biryani and chicken vindaloo. For four people, came up to ~$13 per person - super reasonable! I'm definitely coming again soon.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Come here for a tasty, no-frills, and cheap Pakistani meal - highly recommend the:

- chicken karahi (slow cooked in oil and a creamy sauce; not healthy but so yummy!)
- beef sikh kebab (minced, mixed with spices, and reassembled)
- garlic naan (sprinkled with paprika and garlic roasted; comes out fresh and hot)
- aloo gobhi (a very tasty potatoes and cauliflower dish)

There's also free chai that you can serve yourself! This place deserves five stars for taste and value, and people recognize it - every table was taken by 8 pm on a Tuesday night.
author: Amelia C.

description:
My go-to place for comfort food! Not a fan of the neighborhood but that won't stop me.lol 

They always have my order ready to go in a timely manner. Good customer service and delicious food. Can't go wrong.
author: Katerina Y.

description:
This place isn't exactly the prettiest restaurant you've ever been in but the food is uhhhhmazing. I live way too close to it and have to tell myself no far too many times during the week. 

As a vegan this place is really accommodating when it comes to making sure there's nothing I won't eat in the dish. I'm a super fan of this joint.
author: Alexandra M.

description: They have the best chicken tikki masala in SF :)
author: Grace D.

description:
Love this place!! Absolutely the best Pakistani/Indian food around!! 

The lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, and butter chicken are absolutely delicious and the best I've ever had! The chicken tandoori was good too but I wasn't in love with it like the other dishes. The garlic naan, ohhhh man the garlic naan... It was like love at first sight hahah. 

BYOB kind of place with liquor stores all around
author: Debbie H.

description:
What a great find in the TL. Delicious authentic Indian. I had been searching high and low for an Indian spot in SF for a couple years and this lands the spot of my número uno. Everything is under $10. BYOB w/ no corkage fee. Hope this lasts(!)

Usually opt for the classic "western" choices: chicken tikka masala, basmati rice, & (lots of) garlic naan. All items are consistently good. 

I've become a regular and I've had the pleasure of enjoying the lamb vindaloo, a cauliflower curry, chicken korma, goat curry, palak paneer, etc. Honestly liked everything except for the veggie korma one time tasted a little funky, but I've ordered it since and been thrilled, so maybe it was just me. This is not the cleanest place... But does it matter? It's cheap, pretty quick and if it's cooked for long periods of time over high heat why does it matter? The employees are super nice too - just don't forget to pay on your way out! I know I almost have like 5 times. Good for smaller groups, lots of 4-top tables and there's a big TV for sports fans always playing Warrior's games.

Lahore, I love you. Thanks for plumping me up and keeping me warm on most Friday nights.
author: Katie P.

description:
3.5 

Ordered this tonight for delivery. 
2 Tikka Masala Curry - Medium - was a little too oily for me. When we opened it you can see all the oil settling on top already. Despite stirring there was still a oil type of taste here and there. 

Nann-Really large portions (yay), but very thick and bready. It can be good or bad, but definitely filling. 

Delivery time was around 40 minutes on a Friday night and rainy weather - which is quite good. 

Pricing is good in comparison to another 4 star place that was charging $15.00 for Tikka Masala - Lahore's is only $10. 

Would try again.
author: Suzie B.

description:
Lahore karahi, amongst the few restaurants where you can get Goat. I love goat karahi here. 

The goat is always properly cooked and of course, there wheat roti is good. Its on O' Farrell street in San Francisco downtown and so, lots of places to hangout after the lunch/dinner at Lahore Karahi. They have a free tea too.

Parking and environment: Only street parking and the place is okay(not that great) in terms of neat and clean.

So, enjoy!
author: Pratik J.

description:
Lahore Karahi was recommended to me by several people as having the "best Pakistani food in SF," and I actually have yet to prove them wrong.

The place is unassuming, and not very big, but I never waited more than 5 minutes for a table. It's friendly and comfortable, and their naan is second to "noon"e. Love the chicken tikka and mango lassi. Don't forget to order rice.

The walk here from Market is not for the faint of heart. It's fine as long as you don't mind getting offered various substances from the nice street vendors. If you do mind, get an Uber!
author: Andrew R.

description:
Every bit as good as everybody says. Bhindi masala is my favorite veggie dish here. Tandoori chicken is spiced and charred just right. Naan is perfectly crisp and soft at the same time. Service can be a bit slow but anything worth having is worth waiting a bit longer for right? Small staff too so I won't complain too much about the speed--they are doing the best they can.

Solid for take-out or eat-in. Reasonable prices and good portions.
author: Semuteh F.

description: This place was honestly super delicious. I got the chile naan, vegetable pakora and shasi paneer medium spice. It was perfectly savory and decadent. Not to mention relatively cheap too! Totally yummy.
author: Makana S.

description:
Well..... Food was on the spicy side which is okay for me . 

Tried the garlic nan and the saag paneer. Naan was pretty good but takes a while so id recommend putting in the order early.  Food in general takes a while to arrive but the complimentary masala chai made up for the wait.  

This is not a fast food joint but priced much like it . Would pick up food from here again but maybe not eat in .
author: Vasini G.

description:
Why 3 stars? Because it's just not my thing.

   ---   ---   ---

I debated writing this review, because I've come to a conclusion - food from this part of the world is not for me. I'm very open minded with what I'll eat, but I've rarely enjoyed Indian or Middle Eastern cuisine. I guess I'm writing this for people like me - if you have never really gotten down with this type of food before, I wouldn't recommend starting here. If you aren't keen on spicy stuff, eat elsewhere. If the texture of this cuisine weirds you out, keep walkin'.

I don't have a ton redeeming to mention here, outside of the company I was with. I'm providing an extra star because I don't think it's fair to give a poor review since I've never been a huge proponent of the cuisine in general.
author: Brett N.

description:
I really should have known better than the ignore the signs about bad grad this location had gotten from the health department; then again, I've been to other restaurants that have gotten bad grades and have had amazing food. 

Came here on a first date with someone since he wanted to grab some cheap Indian food since I was too classy for him with my super expensive foods. I had told him that I did enjoy expensive places, but didn't always have to have it. So we decided on Indian food near the TL. 

We ordered chicken vindaloo and chicken tikki masala, some naan and some rice. I didn't end up having any of the rice since I typically don't like rice with my Indian food.  The chicken in the chicken tikki masala was so overcooked and dry.  The curry itself was too watery and not enough cream in it (for me at least).  

It was okay - definitely have had a lot better Indian food. 

Protip: Just go somewhere else. Not the best Indian food out there.
author: Nina Y.

description:
This place is pretty good for what it is. The food tasted awesome, it's cooked to order. 

This place is still in the Tenderloin but a block away from the Chutney, Shalimar, etc. bunch. It looks clean and tidy. The tables are spacious. This place is Self Service. You choose your own seat and take the menu, choose what you want and go up to the counter to order. You can help yourself to water from the fridge or free chai tea. Your food will come to you when it's done. And when you're done - you can go to the counter to pay. 

My friend introduced me to this place. We ordered Butter Chicken and Prawn Tikka Masala, and Garlic Naan and Roti to accompany them. 

The food took awhile but they make everything individually to order so the wait isn't a bad thing. The portion may look small but it will fill you up. The Naan will especially help. 

The Butter Chicken of course is thick, creamy and buttery. The sauce is slightly spicy, enhances the chicken and goes with Naan awesomely. The chicken is a tiny bit dry but still a lot better than Chutney's. They're cut into bite-sized chunks of chicken breast. It's $8.99 

The Prawn Tikka Masala is cooked in a creamy tomato sauce. This sauce has awesome consistency - it's less fatty than the butter chicken, there no oily layer on top. The shrimp was still crisp - tasted very nice and fresh. It's really worth the $11.99. 

The Garlic Naan looks cute and perfectly rounded. It's topped with garlic and herbs. This Naan is not too thick and smells nice. It's not too soft and floppy but not too dey either. This was $2.50. 

The Roti is made of whole wheat so it's druer and less fluffy. It's more dry than Naan - but it's healthy. The crisp bread is good to pick up the sauces. I think this was $1.50. 

This place is tidy and bright and the food is flavorful and taste good. The price is a bit higher than Chutney's but the flavor is more authentic and it's really worth it. At least give it a try.
author: Châu B.

description:
Order up front, be seated and pay when you're finished not a bad concept :)

We stopped off for dinner here on Saturday. Enjoyed the veggie samosas, garlic naan, Chicken Tikka Masala and Tandoori Fish.

Super casual, hole in the wall type place where you aren't rushed and can sit and hang out while enjoying good food.

It appeared to be BYOB, although we didn't know this ahead of time.

Good spot to grab Indian food.
author: Candace L.

description:
So I'm from NJ and am visiting. Ordered the food with my friendand was hoping it'd be at the very least- decent- since it was on UberEats. When it was delivered we had high hopes, but as soon as we opened the bag- things went down south. 

First, I had ordered the Shahi paneer. Now I have had Indian food at a lot of places (I'm Indian as well), but the container of paneer was literally one fourth full with oil, and it was impossible to separate. The oil was so evident you could see a layer at the bottom, the rims, and the top. We tried to spill it out... but it was quite unsuccessful. At this point, I was hungry so I just tried to eat it without a fuss.

Meanwhile, my boyfriend had ordered the butter chicken. He liked the curry part as he had a couple of spoons of it before trying the chicken but once he put the chicken in his mouth... let's just say he spit it out, drank an entire can of iced tea, then some water, and that wasn't enough- mouthwash was necessary. He claimed it was the worst chicken he has ever had. It basically tasted fake, like cardboard. 

The total order with the two entrees and rice was about $30, and I feel like we should be getting a full refund.

Not to mention, I get that people might love this place but if Yelp has a health warning for it, I really would like to wipe this situation out of my mind. Poor food plus poor sanitation, how much more does it take for a restaurant to be shut down?
author: Megha S.

description:
Hot hot tea! Wow this was some great Indian food that hit the spot. Good thing they deliver and I went during the day, otherwise this is a pretty sketch area.

Garlic naan. Yum! CTM was so good  like I haven't had since college and New Haven. If you're craving some great Indian food with friendly service definitely check Lahore out now!
author: Joseph L.

description: DISGUSTING - the 'meat' (and I use that term loosely) in their curries is only fit for dog food. We ordered the lamb tikka and the goat curry, and they had various pieces of what looked like stomach lining, gristle, organs. No actual meat included. $15 a curry - is this a joke! You think you can hide 3rd grade dog food in a thick curry sauce? We were so grossed out we tossed the entire lot and went hungry that night.
author: Anna M.

description: Great food and nice place to hang out.  We were a group of 4 people.  We all loved our food.  I ate the chicken saag and enjoyed it very much.  The garlic naan was also very good.  We stayed there for about 2 hours and hung out there.  The place is a good size and could probably have a decent size group of 8 people.  Service was quick and good.  They only bring out the food.  The price was good for the amount of food provided.
author: Abbas B.

description:
My #1 (and only 1) reason for going to the tenderloin. Tastes great but apparently they get terrible food safety ratings. 

4 stars are based on taste only.
author: Joe D.

description:
*Authentic Indian food
*Best Naan bread
*Spiced right
*Priced right
*Great service

Goodness
author: Monkey B.

description:
Can't say too much about my visit since I only ordered takeout, but what I got was great! Saw this place on the way home from work (I live very close by) and decided to try it because I usually like Indian food and I wasn't disappointed!

I ordered the chicken tikka masala (spicy), rice and regular naan. The tikka had enough kick to it, but it wasn't too hot for me (I'm a medium-spicy kind of person), so I'd probably stick with that. Great flavor on the sauce and the meat wasn't dry at all. Only complaint is that the chicken portions were a bit skimpy, but I had the rice and naan to sop up the rest of the sauce and I'm not complaining about that.

The naan was great and fairly large. Great paired with the tikka sauce and probably should share with a friend (but I didn't and it was wonderful).

All in all I'd definitely go back here! Also I ordered using the Yelp Eat24 app and it worked flawlessly! #hailcorporate
author: Matt B.

description:
You should know that I've only had takeout. So if you're dining in, it's probably best to defer to the judgment of those who have had that experience. But if you're looking for pure food info, perhaps I can lend you a nugget or two of wisdom.

As I prefaced, I ordered takeout. Side note: Ordering takeout via the Yelp app was amazing. Like, the easiest and most painless process ever. And it worked out so smoothly. I want it to happen again and again. 

It was ready super fast, and I had some naan and a basic curry on my hands. This isn't the fanciest food--it had more of a gritty feel and taste to it--but if you want to feel like you're eating there, as opposed to eating Pakistani food in the US, this is a good option. The curry was spicier than I imagined, so watch out for that kick. Also, know that I have a wussy mouth.

The naan fit that same profile. It wasn't the best naan I've had in my life, but it had a nice, deep flavor that let you know it wasn't just a random slab of dough thrown at the Tandoori.

It would take a few more visits to get a feel for the whole place, but if we're making snap judgments, it's definitely earned a second visit from me.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in SF. I've been coming here for a while, even before I had a yelp account! Great service and amazing food. I always order different dishes, can't say I have a favorite. It's a bit spicy, but you can ask for mild. Everything is prepared fresh right in front of you. Not to mention the prices are very affordable.

You can come here on a Friday night and easily get a table. It's of those hidden jewels in the Tenderloin. You have to know the area to really know about this spot. It's family owned and there's another one called Alhamra in the Mission on 16th. Try this spot out, you won't be disappointed, especially if your into Indian or Pakistani food. You can't go wrong.
author: Black Frankenstien ..

description: It's self service- go in and get your seat, but go up to the counter when you're ready to order and get your own water. I think this place is better for take out IMO. But it's some of the best Indian/Pakistani-an food in the city.
author: Monica S.

description:
Ordered: 
Butter Chicken Masala: 2/5 The chicken was WAY too dry. It was impossible to break apart with my fork and I could probably chew on a piece for days if I wanted to because it was so overcooked. The masala was neither rich nor creamy, it tasted quite bland. 

Chicken Tikka Masala: 3/5 The flavor was a lot better than the butter chicken. Chicken was still very dry. 

Garlic Naan: 2/5 Despite how good it looked (refer to my photos), there was no flavor. I expected the naan to be a mouthful of garlic yumminess but instead received a mouthful of bland carbs instead. 

Service: 1/5 I highly recommend this restaurant to hire someone to bus tables because all the tables around me were filled with dirty dishes. The tub where you usually put your dirty dishes in was already filled to the brim with dirty dishes. Only two people were working and they were both cooking and taking orders. It took a solid 20 minutes for my boyfriend and I to receive our food and took another 5 minutes standing at the counter for one of the employees to give us the check and for us to pay and leave. This restaurant is not run well at all, they definitely need more employees working because it seems like it takes forever for things to get done. 

If you're looking for a quick place to grab a bite to eat, I would not recommend this restaurant but if you're trying to kill time and don't mind an under-averaged plate of Indian food, you could try this place.
author: Courtni W.

description:
3.5
I thought this place maybe slightly better than some of the other places I have been to.  You order first, then sit.

Had the garlic naan, chicken cheese naan, chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, and lamb vindaloo.
The butter chicken was the best out of the three.
I prefer the chicken tikka masala better at Chutney, although the meat is really dry there.
The lamb vindaloo was nothing memorable but it wasn't bad.
You couldn't taste the chicken in the chicken cheese naan.
The meal was pretty inexpensive.
author: Heejin L.

description: I came here a few days ago with some friends and got some food poisoning :( I guess I shouldn't really be surprised considering that Yelp alerted me of Lahore's "Poor Food Safety Score" when I came to this business page. Nann here is good, but I've actually never had bad nann, so that really doesn't say much. My staple go-to dish, chicken tiki masala, was very disappointing. Flavor wise, it was just a bit off... like it was watered down? The curry wasn't as thick as I'm used to, and as a result, I didn't taste the subtle sweetness you get with the savory of chicken tiki masala. BYOB which is cool, but I'm going to avoid this place until the health issue gets resolved.
author: Austin W.

description: Had this place for dinner one night while staying for a conference, and it was pretty decent. Taste is super good, but I got sick afterwards. I'm hesitant to blame that on the (frankly delicious) curry I had, though - could have been anything else I'd had that day, but seeing the health rating I'm a tad suspicious.
author: Jessica K.

description:
Ehhh..... BEWARE OF DIRTY kitchen, bathroom, and a long wait for your food. When my group of friends got in, there was only one other person in the store. It's a self serve place, so you go up and pay/order your food. The water didn't seem clean, so I would recommend buying a water bottle next door! It looks like the kitchen guy was using the same pan to cook all the dishes... There was a croc roach on the wall and the set up station has something that looked like puke... Yuck. The curry I ordered are

-potatoes w/cauliflower: ehh it was alright. Had better curries. 

-garlic nan: delicious! The winner of the night! 

-tiki masala: pretty good! Enjoyed it and the flavors. 

Overall an okay experience.. Waited 45 mins for our food!
author: Vivian N.

description: Excellent food in San Francisco. Service was prompt, all the items were very tasty  and authentic!! We ordered Beef sheekh kababs, chicken tandoori boti and Karahi chicken, all the items were just too good!
author: Tazmin K.

description: We ordered take out from here a month ago and the food was terrible. The saag paneer was completely bland. It had zero flavor. I tried adding salt to it but it didn't help. The chicken tikka masala had no spice. Also rice isn't included which wasn't mentioned on the online menu at all. The naan was also very dry.
author: Lisa D.

description:
Awesome Indian food. Super authentic and great.

It's not a great neighborhood, but the food is worth it.
author: JT O.

description:
The place seems really unhygienic. The staff is unfriendly and we wanted some lemon with our food and had to ask 3-4 times, before we got ONE piece. 
The food's okay, except the dal makhani, which is really good and the only reason we go there.

Keep in mind, I'm a vegetarian and can't comment on the meat dishes.
author: Namrata J.

description:
Lahore's new mantra is somewhat like Pink Floyd's, but instead of, "we don't need no education", it's more like "we don't need no service."

There used to be a waiter. There used to more than one person doing all the cooking. It used to not take over an hour to get your food. 

I just don't care. The food is even better than it was before. The sole chef is back in the kitchen non-stop. Sometimes he doesn't have time to take your money, but you better wait and pay. You'd get a karmic asskicking if you didn't give monetary thanks for this amazing food.

The lamb biryani at Lahore is unrivaled. The lamb is tender, and the biryani cooked to perfection. Recently had the matar paneer, and it too had an interesting flavor combination. The naan are standard, except for the one with the dried fruit, which is a treat and almost a dessert on its own. 

Don't come here for lunch if you don't have a hour or two to spare, and I certainly wouldn't recommend going before a show in the area unless you have ample time. But do come when you slow your roll. You won't find food this perfect, this inspired, and this affordable everyday.
author: Joanna M.

description:
Although located in the sketchy tenderloin district, this place is hands down the best Indian restaurant I've gone to. 

My boyfriend ordered the Butter Chicken and I Ordered the chicken biryani. Both dishes contained a lot of flavor, but the Butter Chicken definitely took the gold. The sauce was rich and creamy and the chicken was oh so tender. The naan was also fluffy and soft, nothing like the chewy ones you get at the Indian express food places. 

The Chicken biryani was a bit dry but the self- served-sauce they provided definitely provided that moistness. The flavor was there, but the texture was a bit off for me. Overall, this is a solid place for Indian food.
author: Angela L.

description: The new management needs some classes in customer service.Food is okay not your typical authentic Indian or Pakistani. The only way this place is in business is due to deliveries and pick ups. I wouldn't recommend anyone to eat in here. Tables are left unattended even after customers have left.
author: Cody R.

description:
Some of the most bland Indian food I've had, there are plenty of other delicious options in the area. Skip it. 
The delivery was fast though.
author: John W.

description:
I came here for lunch with my girlfriend. We got the Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan. 

The Chicken Tikka Masala was great. it was well seasoned and had the perfect taste to it. However, the chicken was extremely dry.

The Butter Chicken Masala was a tad bland. It wasn't nearly as creamy or rich as most Butter Chicken Masalas and the chicken was extremely dry as well.

The Garlic Naan smelled and looked delicious but it wasn't very garlic-y. 

Overall, the Butter Chicken and Garlic Naan lacked flavor. However, the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious. They were understaffed leading to very slow service. There were only two people working the register and kitchen combined. 

Would definitely come back but only for the Chicken Tikka Masala.
author: Ray W.

description: I felt the need to write a review after seeing the warning on Yelp. I have gone to Lahore karahi ever since I found it on Check Please on PBS years ago. Let me start by saying that I am a very picky eater. But there tandoori fish and tandoori chicken are F'in Delicious. It's a small restaurant with maybe about 20 to 25 seats, which makes it on Friday or Saturday night very busy. They are always very friendly and they have a BYOB policy.
author: Neil T.

description:
I was a little disappointed this last time. I have had many great meals here but i felt like they held back on the spice and full flavor. It tasted a little like Indian / Paki food that has been toned down for Americans.

I hope this is not a trend because I have really enjoyed some of the meals I have had here.
author: Greg G.

description: This place is utter garbage: low quality ingredients laden with oil.  Threw away our entire order from eat24 tonight... :/
author: Nishant J.

description: I've been dying to try this out.  The food was just bland and not what I expected.  I ordered through Ubereats and used their app.  So it might have been lost in translation.  Ordered the food extra spicy and it's pretty tasteless.
author: Billy B.

description:
Absolutely hands down one of the best Indian restaurants I've been too. I have  eaten here at least 20 times and the food is unreal. 

What a nice little place.
author: Robert A.

description: Best Paki restaurant in San Francisco! Chicken tikka was amazing! Nehari is a secret special dish they can make. Very spicy!!! I LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
author: Kareena R.

description:
The food is great, my problem is the management and the online ordering system they used cal Mealhifive.com. in march 2016 I order pick up twice, bith times the store was closed. Found out later they closed for remodeling. I called meal hifive and they were energetic about refunding my money but nothing happened. So I stopped by the resturant after they reopened and asked to speak to a manager, the manager walked over and greated me in perfect english until after I explained the situation and then he immediatly stated that he doesnt understand what I am saying and then made a confused look. So I called mealhifive again and the refunded 1 of the orders. I then had to call again to find out they went out of buisness. I decided to give the resturant a second chance since the online ordering is outside of their control. And there service is now horrible.  Its truly sad that a once great resturant is gone.

Ok. So after waiting 1.5 hours for a pick up meal, and checking in, givong my name and sitting down in front of them, they tried to give ne the wrong order so I gave them my name again. Turns out yhey dont know where the food went, finally 30 mins later they find my order under the table.

This was by far the absolute worst experience i have had with a resturant including Dicks where they intentionally treat you like shit. 

Fuck this resturant.

Update* 
After getting home, i found the food is not even close to what it used to be. At least this makes it easier to not return here again.
author: Jason S.

description: The biryani was fantastic, light in oil but the spices were beautifully blended to give it a delicious taste. The tandoori chicken was juicy, succulent and the meat was tender just as desired. I am looking forward to coming here again. If you are looking for authentic Indian/Pakistani food, this is the place to be.
author: Sayantika M.

description: Had Lahore a few hours ago. Can't stop thinking about it. Best restaurant in SF, maybe even the whole world. I recommend the whole menu, and I know a lot.
author: Alex H.

description:
NOTE to yourself,  do NOT dine here during  a HOT day/night because this place has NO AC!!!!!!!!!!  Only eager to dine here because of that stupid episode from "Check Bay Please" & NOT  looking forward to return here anytime soon! 

One star for their Garlic Naan 

One star for their Lamb Samosa 

Butter Chicken - The sauce was A-OK,  but the highlight of this dish aka Chicken was HARD & inedible; such disappointment! 

Lamb Kabab - Alright. 

Aloo Golbi - Cauliflower with potatoes  - Nothing special & quite  bland.
author: Katy N.

description:
With every trip to San Francisco, I HAVE to pay a visit to Lahore Karahi. And even at that, it's still not enough for me. I could eat it everyday. This past SF visit, as soon as I returned to my hotel room from dinner, I couldn't help but think: "Man, i want more. Why did we leave our leftovers? Why, oh why?!"

So here's the lowdown. This is legit Pakistani resto (and trust me, I'm a halfsie). It's a true hole-in-the-wall with the best, spiciest, most authentic Pakistani fare ... and to top it off, it's inexpensive (not just by SF standards) and it's BYOB! And no cork fee.

The reason why their prices are so cheap is the fact that everything is self serve. You seat yourself; you grab your own water, non-alcoholic bevs and plates/cutlery at the setup station; you order at the register; and you pay at the register after dinner. All they do is bring out your food - your delicious-delicious, mouth-watering, food.

Everything is served family style, so share with your table-mates. And since the portions are huge, I rec ordering two less entrees than there are people, especially if you're ordering naan and apps (lamb and veggie samosas are always a hit!) 

All and all, this last company dinner we had seven people and dinner was LESS THAN $100. If you factor in our three bottles of wine and beer that we brought in, along with tip, it was $25 a person ... and there was still plenty of food on the table for at least two more people. Tell me where else in SF can you get a quality sit-down, non-fast food dinner plus 2-3 glasses of wine for 25 bones? No where, except Lahore!

And my colleagues would agree. Within the Yelp CM family across the globe, we all pretty much love this place. It's practically tradition to visit Lahore.

BTDubb: They don't take rezzies and the place is small, so anticipate a short wait. However, this last visit, the gent on the phone kindly made an acception and held a table for my dinner group.
author: Farrah A.

description:
Had been craving samosas, so thought this place might be worth a stop, after reading some recommendations in talk threads and looking at some of the pictures. Big mistake.

The samosas were surprisingly bland, and the rest of the food wasn't anything to write home about either. In fact, had been planning to try a bunch of dishes but decided not to after trying the samosas, naan, and some tandoori dishes.
Staff very friendly.
Restaurant seems lacking in terms of cleanliness.
Pretty disgusting neighborhood to be walking through after dark. Lots of apparently homeless people camped out on the sidewalks, along with a number rough-looking sorts milling about in the area. From the looks and smells, the sidewalks definitely could use a good scrubbing.
author: Aris F.

description:
I have a small (okay large) place in my heart for cheap, ethnic, eats and Lahore delivers!

I came with a group of six and we ordered lamb biriyani, bhindi masala (curried okra), butter chicken, tandoori fish, aloo gobi, and lamb vindaloo and shared family style. We ate ourselves silly and still had tons of leftovers. Since we were staying in a hotel, nobody wanted to cart the leftovers home but as a testament to how good the food was, we all regretted our decision approximately one hour later.

This restaurant is not very service oriented which is probably a reason why it is so inexpensive. You place your order from behind the counter and grab your drinks from a little fridge on the side of the restaurant. I did not mind this at all, it made the whole experience all the more cozy and inviting (perhaps due to their BYOB/BYOW policy?!?!).
author: Kimberly S.

description:
I had a fantastic meal at Lahore Karahi the first time I came here: the chicken tandoori was super moist & flavorful, the chicken tikka masala deliciously seasoned & spiced, and the naan was warm, buttery & crispy on the outside & chewy on the inside. It was seriously that memorable.

However, when I came here a few weeks ago, the food left much to be desired. The chicken tandoori was still pretty good, but the chicken tikka masala was bland and the naan was not memorable.

Also, I had initially called in to place an order, but could not really understand the questions from their staff over the phone, so I decided to come & eat in instead. I told them on the phone that I'd be coming in to the restaurant, but they still tried calling my phone back incessantly to get my order. I received several missed calls in the time it took me to cab to the restaurant. Who does that? Ugh.

My last experience here makes me sad, because I thought I had found my go-to Indian restaurant in the city, and sadly, this is not the case.
author: Grace C.

description:
Accept it, Lahore Karahi is smacked right at the middle of the Tenderloin and probably won't be winning "best restaurant design" or "most romantic ambiance" awards in our lifetime.  Heck, if SF had a restaurant grading system similar to So. Cal, I won't put my money on an "A" level grade.

The sooner we get over that, the sooner we can learn to appreciate what Lahore is really about...just awesome Indian food cooked and presented just the way it ought to be...dishes made to order by a man passionate about his craft...dishes characterized by lively spices and flavors.  In a nutshell, this place is great.

Lahore has the best garlic naan I've had.  It had that nice buttery flavor, and it stayed warm and crispy throughout the meal.  The garlic was there but was not obnoxious.  Quite fantastic, really.  The Matar Paneer was also unbelievably good, with the perfect level of creaminess and spice, certainly the kind of dish that will make you use the naan to wipe off every remaining drop.

I was actually at five stars until the chicken vindaloo came.  I'll be brief because the shortcomings are not that big of a deal, but suffice it to say that the chicken vindaloo left more to be desired.  Perhaps Chef Haider inadvertently squeezed one too many lemons, but it crossed the line between tangy and sour, plus it only had three small pieces of chicken.  The side order of bamati rice was also nothing special.

Also, the tap water was a little cloudy, so I suggest opting for canned soda or lassi.  The water had a subtle coconut flavor, and we couldn't figure out if it was meant to be that way or if the flavor was a remnant of a previous drink order.  

Okay, the water thing was very disappointing.  Other than that, the hits were big and the misses were minor.  It's clear that Lahore is a quality establishment, worthy of all the hype of being considered as one of the best Indian restaurants in SF.  There was even a lady from the New York Times snapping pictures of the food from every conceivable angle.  Apparently, she's featuring this place in an upcoming food review.  I will be surely be back and will consider an upgrade.  This time, I will not let the Tandoori Fish get away.
author: Angel S.

description:
If Yelp allowed it, I would give 4.8 stars.

5-star review for the food and nice guys working here.  You won't find better Indian/Pakistani food for sure.  We had the eggplant and vegetable biryani, both of which were out-of-this-world.  Try the green sauce they have in the fridge (below the sodas).  And stop at the corner market for a beer or bring a bottle of wine.  It's byob, but they provide beer and wine glasses.

I'm hesitant to say 4 stars for the actual restaurant because the food was absolutely incredible, but the atmosphere and presentation aren't there.  It's very clean, but a little cluttered.  There's a self-serve station for water/coffee and a fridge for drinks.  The tables are sort of cafeteria-feeling and there were 3 dirty tables when we walked in (still full of dirty dishes when we left).  While this did not take away from the food at all, they would certainly do well to add a little decor to create a more cozy/cool ambiance.  

Don't let the store-front or interior keep you from trying this place.  The food is amazing, and the guys are so nice.  I'm sure they could keep the place exactly as it is now and be very successful for years to come.  Unfortunately I don't live in SF, but if I did this would be a weekly dinner spot for sure!
author: Lindsey C.

description: I dream of the Naan here. Delicious and cheap -- BYOB!
author: Jordan K.

description: Delicious naan! However, mister chef, meet salt & Pakistani spices! With a name like Lahore Karahi, you failed to deliver authentic Lahori (Pakistani) cuisine. (This is respectfully said from a Pakistani)....That's all.
author: Umi V.

description: I ordered to-go on Uber eats for chicken tikka masala, a classic dish I base my initial judgement of quality of Indian restaurants. For $13, I thought it would a good filling meal, but when I got my food, I realized that it doesn't come with rice, and I have to order that separately! If I had only known! While it was a bit assumptive of me based my other experiences with Indian cuisine, I was never forewarned! If I had known and wanted to eat a full meal at Lahore, I would have had bought the $4 rice also. Instead, I was left to my small soup container of tikka masala, eating it like soup. It was pretty delicious but not the prime of the tikka masala I have had. Later I found out this place is also unhygienic! Bleh.
author: Tuan T.

description: Good quality South Asian place.  A bit hole in wall.  The chicken tandoori was excellent. The saag paneer was good.  The garlic bread was good too.  The pista kulfi and mango ice cream were ok.  Our bill came out to be around $48 was average given what we ordered.
author: robert s.

description: The people complaining about the self serve are funny, you're not in the burbs anymore this is SF! Welcome to an awesome hole in the wall restaurant, where you can byob, wine or liquor. I crave Lahore and my friends that are from Indian and Pakistan co-sign on this place. The owner/mom comes in the morning and preps the food. I try and come here once a week. My favs, chicken tiki masala, naan bread, rice and aloo saag, tandoori fish. If the restaurant is to dirty for you cause you're use to going to apples bees, chills and bj's, then get to go.
author: Sarah T.

description: So far I have ordered from here twice and it seems ok compared to Pakwaan. If you need a little different taste try this place.
author: Neil S.

description:
Lahore Karahi is what makes the Tenderloin the TANDOOR-loin.

I've been eating here for years and have tried many of the other Tandoor-loin Pakistani counterparts down the street, including Pakwan and Shalimar.  However, Lahore Karahi outperforms its peers.

My favorite dishes here involve the tandoor oven, naturally.  These include Tandoori Chicken, Beef Kebabs, and their excellent Naan.  The chicken and the kebabs are served on a sizzling hot plate with grilled peppers, onions, and a few slices of lime for additional flavor.  Chicken Tikka Masala and Channa dishes are among other dishes that I've tried and enjoyed.  The Mango Lassi is also BAD (in a late 1980's way, so good). 

Before going to Lahore Karahi, one should be aware that you're going solely for the food. Service and ambiance are pretty also BAD (in a non-late 1980's way, so bad).   For instance, my friend asked a "server" for some water, and he received a grunt and index-finger led point in response towards the pitchers at the bottom of the refrigerator.  This along with other examples have mentally prepared myself to go in expecting only good food and not much more.

My favorite Pakistani spot in, not only the Tandoor-loin, but in all of San Francisco.
author: Sebastian N.

description:
Everything we ordered was great, especially the naan.

My sister and her boyfriend have eaten here several times because of a recommendation from her Indian friend. A good hole-in-the-wall joint to try Pakistani/Indian food in the city.

I read that the original owner opened a new spot in the city and the food here isn't the same.  I would give this place a try and seek out the new place as well to give that a try and compare.

They serve all you can drink self serve chai here.
author: Anne Explores LA +.

description: Don't be scared off by the Tenderloin location or the health department rating that Yelp reminds you of.  The food is fine.  It's a mixed bag, however, very uneven, some stuff (like that garlic naan that people have raved about) being excellent -- loved the tandoori chicken -- but other things like the saag paneer, which is usually can't miss, being very bland and watery.  I'd go back, as friends have told me they have good nights and lesser nights, but it's not really a discovery.
author: George G.

description:
Summary - Good Indian food. Hole-in-the-wall place that's good for lunch. Try the tandoori fish.

I came here for lunch on a weekday around noon. The place was pretty empty (2 - 3 other people there). There was a bit of a wait for the food to arrive (~25 minutes).

Tandoori Fish - Best dish by far. I haven't ordered fish at an Indian restaurant before, so wasn't sure what to expect, but turned out to be a great choice.

Chilli Cheese Naan - Garlic naan is usually my go-to choice, but saw the chilli naan mentioned in some yelp reviews. Had a nice kick to it. Would order again.

Lamb Vindaloo - Pretty good dish. Not extremely memorable, but the lamb was cooked well.
 
The place itself is pretty hole-in-the-wall, with about 10 - 15 tables.
author: Andrey L.

description:
Food was really tasty! I wish I could tell you the plates we ordered. My sister did all the ordering and we ate it family style -- every plate was excellent! Staples like naan and rice were on point.  

Not five stars because the service was not the best: never refilled our waters and never asked how everything was going for example. 

As others have said, it's sort of a hole-in-the-wall establishment but that shouldn't deter you from trying this super authentic Indian food. Also you can BYOB.
author: Jackie Z.

description:
I'm updating my review because of the serious degradation in food quality and value. The new owner is longer present at the restaurant. Looks like the new owner promoted the kitchen aid to the master chef. This is a serious mistake and is the reason why I must downgrade my review to one star (I gave this place three stars after the new owner took over, after he bought the place from the previous owner). 

I ordered the Lamb Vindaloo and Saag Paneer with an order of garlic naan and basmati rice. These are staples that are pretty hard to mess up, but this new "master" chef did. Lamb vindaloo had some heavy oil, filled with a invasive chili powder that gave me almost instant heart burn. I love spicy foods and its pretty rare to trigger that response inside me, but I think its the liberal use of cooking oil that is causing this reaction. Not only that, but there's only three pieces of lamb in my dish. Each lamb piece is the size of my pinky finger. 

The Saag Paneer was bland yet spicy at the same time, an odd combination that left the same bad taste in my mouth as trickle-down economics. Saag Paneer is supposed to have this explosive, orgasmically spiced creamy flavor mixed with the mild subtlety of cheese. This Saag Paneer lacked most of those qualities. 

Some may seriously disagree with my review, but that's because they're not acquainted with a) the Old Lahore or b) good Indian/Pakistani food. This new chef is merely throwing things into a pan without understanding how the ingredients complement each other (so he doesn't know how to control each ingredient). Combined with the expensive dish prices (I paid $22.10 for my above order: yes, that's expensive for this "hole-in-the-wall" place), this place lost any respect I had after the new owner took over.
author: Peter C.

description: My boyfriend introduced me to this little gem less than a year ago and it's safe to say that we are OBSESSED!!!! I have never had food that was so good. We love the tandoori fish, tandoori chicken, naan and the rice. Hands down one of the best places to get food in San Francisco. They don't sell liquor or booze, but they have a BYOB policy with a plethora of liquor/corner stores nearby. The place is small with limited seating, but it is well worth the wait. You can also order to go as through Grubhub. The guys in the back are always so nice and welcoming. The food is made fresh once you place your order, so there is a wait to get your food but once again, it is well worth the wait. I can't wait to come back!!!
author: Lacey B.

description: Love this place! A place that I truly miss from SF. the taste of come back is long lasting. Very affordable price and big portion. Although not a very pleasant sitting area, but perfect for a quite bite or to go!
author: Cecilia C.

description: Charming and casual hole in the wall. Good Indian food at great prices. We enjoyed being able to grab our own chutney and sauces. The garlic naan was especially good and the samosas were nice and flaky. Good vegetarian options, and my only complaint is I wish my curry had been a bit spicier. This is a safe bet if you're in the area and don't feel like table service.
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Ordered via eat24. Two hours and many phone calls later, they let eat24 know they didn't have a driver available. 

The food is good, but not good enough to wait 3 hours for it (if it ever arrives). It would make more sense to cancel orders instead of angering customers.
author: A E.

description: This place was picked at random by me & my friend visiting from Singapore tonight and I'm glad we did. I have to say it was really good. We had the Chicken Korma, Lamb biryani and some naan and it was all delicious. The interior doesn't look amazing but it doesn't need to. The food is good enough and everyone who works there is friendly. :) I definitely foresee myself coming here again.
author: Panda R.

description: Really great food. Ordered the chicken tikka masala, chicken tandoori and garlic naan. Tikka masala was fabulous. Just about the best i have had in the bay area. Garlic naan was good too. This is a self service place and the establishment looks more like a dhaba than a restaurant. If you are not a stickler for ambiance, do give this place a try. The food is really awesome. Do not miss it due to the stupid yelp warning.
author: Manish S.

description:
I always say you know it's an authentic Indian hole-in-the-wall when there's a VCR TV on the wall playing Bollywood music videos =).

Just know that it's self serve water, utensils, etc. And you have to go up to the counter to order. And it's this ONE guy cooking for and serving everyone!! So even at 10pm on a weeknight our food took a while. 

Oh and it's BYOB! I'll keep that in mind for next time..

LAHORI CHIKKAR CHOLEY - 5.50
Garbanzo beans cooked in a special blend of tomatoes and onions 
- A little too starchy/salty (if I'm being picky).

SHAHl PANEER - 7.50
Lightly fried cheese cooked with nuts in tomato sauce 
- Loved this!
- Slightly sweet yet tangy, with a tiny bit of a spicy kick at the end.
- Paneer was soft and chewy.

LAHORE KARAHI RICE - 2.00
Basmati rice seasoned with special blend of spices
- Not much here, mainly got it as a mixer for our curries. Rice is fairly dry, and I didn't taste much of the flavoring. You get a fairly giant plate though.

ONION KULCHA - 2.50
Naan stuffed with onions and fresh cilantro 
- Wonderful! Loved the onions in the middle.
- A tiny tiny tiny bit burnt on the bottom but I'm being picky.
- Otherwise perfect texture, fluffy but with a good slight crisp.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
So I finally made it out here to try the "new" Lahore Karahi (post-Guddu). I have so many fond memories of this place, it hurts to write this review. 

Back then? Late nights after 12-hour conference setups and takedowns at the the Moscone Center -- meeting new friends who I'm still friends with, about a decade after the fact. Back then, the spicy was spicy, the service was friendly, and the food was just amazingly tasty. Sometimes we would just get random freebees I can't even name after sharing a full table of food. Lahore used to have feel more like a Pakistani greasy spoon. It was local. It was in the TL back when tourists didn't feel comfortable entering the TL.

Now? It's sterile... not that I want cockroaches in my food, but I don't want to feel I'm in a hospital cafeteria either. The service is markedly slower (and frankly, more rude -- I felt like I wasn't wanted there, and I'm accommodating when it comes to food service), and the food? With the departure of Guddu, it's just not the same level of flavor, and it's definitely not the same quality of product.

You can do better. I'm sad to say goodbye to a memory, but I've got to do something to counter all the 5-stars this place had from its glory days. Take a look at the rating trends folks... things have just gone downhill.
author: Amy P.

description:
Quickest review possible:
Great food
Really friendly service
Small restaurant - hole in the wall but charming
No corkage fee, bring whatever you want (literally) - if you forget, there's a liquor store across the street
Good for a casual date or group of friends
author: Adrian M.

description:
My kindred Yelper Liz S. so inspired me with her knowledgeable review of Lahore Karahi on "Check Please! Bay Area" that it finally motivated Jamie W. and me to try it finally after all these years. We were expecting a madhouse of chaos, but we must have come after Katrina came through since all we saw were piles of dirty dishes all around. We honestly didn't know whether we should wait for the young waiter to clean it all up or just pitch in with some Palmolive and a pair of Playtex gloves from the Walgreen's down O'Farrell. 

We decided to wait and hoped the waiter would wipe down the table. Alas, Jamie got a stain on his beloved Threadless T-shirt due to leftover curry sauce on the rim of the table, and only my Diet Coke came. Note we both ordered Diet Cokes and only mine came. Not Jamie's, mine. Things were not off to a promising start. However, once the food started coming, all was forgiven. We started with the $3 basket of Vegetable Pakora, tasty and surprisingly light veggie fritters that looked like they came from South Carolina, not South Pakistan (see photo). But the exotic spices came through with each bite. 

I ordered the $6.50 Butter Chicken, which consisted of Tandoori chicken pieces bathing in a buttery cream sauce (see photo). Very tender with carrots and spices complementing the flavor. Jamie went for the $7 Lamb Korma, which was just as tender and succulent though a bit hazardous to spoon since the bowl was filled to the brim with the spicy sauce (see photo). We skipped the naan in favor of a plate of Basmati rice to make sure we sop up all the sauces. Genuinely delicious but maybe bring a sponge just in case the waiter doesn't have time to be thorough next time. 

FOOD - 4.5 stars...homemade Pakistani dishes done up right and packed with flavor 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...well... 
SERVICE - 4 stars...the attentive young server was everywhere 
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely worthy of a return visit...thanks Liz!
author: Ed U.

description: I LOVE this place!! I always call ahead of time and order by phone. My to go is usually done really fast! By the time I get there it's ready for me to pay! I can't get enough of their butter chicken & garlic nann! This place gives me LIFEEEEEE!
author: Ruhjeenuh Z.

description: Butter chicken was great! We had dinner on our trip and loved this place. Pretty relaxed vibe with great food. Others ordered chicken tikka masala, rice with garlic and cheese naan. Loved the cheese naan! Everything was great and will return on our next trip!
author: Daniella W.

description: While the location may be a lotta bit sketchy, once inside let your appetite take charge. Every plate is delish, service is easy, and the freshly made chai will be enough to hold you over while you hear and smell your meal being prepared. Great go to spot for groups.
author: Regina D.

description:
Gotta be 4 stars. Amazing food, no messing around. Certainly nice to experience something different than the usual posh San Francisco faire. 

4 just because well, it doesn't feel like a 5 star place. Definitely had better. A bit odd, had to grab my water jug from the fridge myself, which was funny. 

Enjoyable all around. Some shady characters coming by what do expect in this part of town. 

Definitely recommend.
author: Vic V.

description:
Taken for what it is, Lahore Karahi is my favorite Indian/Pakastani restaurant so far. I'm no expert of the cuisine but the favors are on point. Most dishes seem to be made to order so you will have to wait a bit after you order. I'm fine with that and it's worth it. 

Don't skip the garlic naan no matter what else you order. Saag paneer was very tasty as well as the classic tikka masala. The lamb vindaloo had nice spice and the raita helped to cool the pallet. Will have to try some tandoori next time. 

Give them a try and byob!
author: Jin R.

description:
The food is good. I was with a friend here last night. We ordered Butter Chicken and Lamb Vindaloo for curries. For the breads, we ordered Roti and Naan. The Butter Chicken was better than the Lamb Vindaloo. I like things a little more spicy. So the Butter Chicken could have been more spicy. But nevertheless it tasted good. Lamb Vindaloo was just okay. The best part was the Naan. These were the best Naans I have ever had. Soft, fluffy and non-rubbery. They had the perfect texture and easy to break with just three fingers. Unlike most Naans which keep on stretching when you try to break them. 
The place is small and cluttered but everyone comes here for the food. They also had something called BYOD - Bring Your Own Drink going on. Chilled out laid back!
author: Akshay M.

description:
Every dish was spectacular. Tandoori chicken was crispy on outside and juicy and flavorful on inside. Best tikka masala I have ever had (I take my tikka masala seriously)

Get the Tandoor fish, pakoras and samosas, garlic naan

Another plus, big squeeze bottle sauces .

So good!! 

They were out kheer ( rice pudding- was a bummer.. And you have to bring your own beer. Another bummer.


Feels like you are in someone's kitchen--meaning the food was like home cookin.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Great food that's relatively cheap and quick. Their garlic naan is wonderful and I can't get enough of their Butter Chicken. They're doing it the right way here and the staff is super friendly. No frills here. Just good food.
author: Steve T.

description:
I went here with a group of people before getting tons of drinks at Tradition. None of us were hungover the next day. In fact, we were barely drunk, which was not the norm for us after that many drinks. In other words, this place is a great buffer against drunkness.

Drinking aside, the food is great. They cook everything to order and you can see them cooking your food too. They were very friendly and their food was exceptional. Great North Indian/Pakistani restaurant! Highly recommended.
author: Kelly B.

description:
We ordered a delivery through Eat24 for dinner.  The Lamb Samosa were good and the Naan was thick and filling which was great as those were the only two items we enjoyed.  

Shahi Paneer Tikka Masala was 6 pieces of cheese in a watery thin masala sauce.  It was far better than the Chicken Tikka Masala.  That one had few extra dry cubes of chicken with a sauce that separated into a thick layer of oil and a pinkish residue.   It was a very small portion but we did not manage to finish it.   

Lamb Biryani was OK and a Chicken Tandoori was missing from the delivery and was refunded by Eat24.
author: Yoram F.

description:
TL;DR - Brilliant food, great prices. Full of flavor, tender meat dishes.

So far I've had the Butter Chicken, Tikka Masala, Lamb Vindaloo, and Vegetable Korma. They were all exceptional. Some of the best indian food I've had in San Francisco. They took Korma to a whole new level for me. Cheese naan was also really good.

You order at the cash register when you walk in, so if your looking for a "nice" restaurant with attentive waiters this really isn't the place for you. I prefer ordering upfront it lets me enjoy my meal in peace and provides me the opportunity to leave when I want.
author: Adam M.

description: I had recently gotten take-out from here twice while on vacation. The food is amazing! One of my favorites! And the prices are not too bad. I will definitely be back here again!
author: Laura D.

description:
The naan for $1 is unbeatable. I prefer to sit down and eat it there, but more often grab it to-go through one of their various on-line or app ordering options.  

The Chicken Tikka Masala is rich, flavorful (Med-spicy has a nice kick), and comes with big chunks of moist tandoori chicken.  Add the mango lassi and you have the 1-2-3 combo.
author: Monica Z.

description:
This is by far the best N. Indian cuisine that one would find in SF even though it is Pakistani ( some parts of N.India and Pakistan share the same culture and food habits).

My favorites are the Chicken Karahi, Goat Curry even though the Chicken tandoori and Butter chicken are not bad. The Garlic Naan and Onion Kulcha are my staple orders for bread. Everything is cooked fresh and so will take some time but worth it. The Biryanis are good too here.

The  best part is that in the end, it is not expensive!
author: Vijay N.

description:
Ordered naan, tandoori chicken, chicken biryani, chole, and pakoras. 

This place is average I'd say. The naan was the best, the rest was good, but not great. The three stars is mainly for flavor, someone who doesn't like a lot of taste, will love this place. As for me I'm a bit of a snob for flavor and when I order tandoori chicken,m and biryani I expect the flavors to be on point.  Overall good, fresh, hot, inexpensive, and standard so you can't go wrong. They asking make good chai which is complimentary.
author: Miss K.

description: Food safety scores are for squares. We all know the best places in SF look like (and often are) someone's family kitchen that's been dishing out food nonstop for years. Lahore Karahi's garlic naan is the best naan in San Francisco, hands down. Everything else is pretty fantastic. Chicken tikka & sag dal are my favorites. I'm pretty sure it's BYOB too.
author: Natalie P.

description: Simple good veggie options (daal and saag aloo) surprisingly good and without the oil.
author: Rajash S.

description:
Was really craving some good Indian food when I came across this little joint on Yelp, and decided to try it out. Originally came here to satisfy my lamb biryani craving...

It's a small place in the TL, where a ton of great cheap food is located. They were out of lamb stock so we couldn't order any lamb entrees, which is usually my favorite meat to order at Indian restaurants. They also didn't have vegetable samosas that we wanted, so that was kind of a bummer.

Chicken tikka masala: absolutely amazing. Creamy and flavorful in all the ways you want your tikka masala to be. 

Chicken biryani: I thought the chicken in this dish was pretty dry, although it had great flavor otherwise. We spooned some of the masala from our other entree into the rice which made it taste pretty good.

Garlic naan: probably one of my favorite things here!! I'll definitely be back to try this.

Mango lassi: excellent flavor; sweet, a bit tangy, not too thick, but could definitely taste the yogurt.

The only qualm I had about this place was that it took really long to get our food, so budget some time for that.
author: Chrystal Z.

description:
Lahore Karahi seems to have changed hands and the food is somewhat better. Unfortunately still carrying on the tradition of really really long waits between ordering and you having curry to put your face in, but at least the portions are heftier and the flavors deeper. And no more of the weird sprinkles of pistachios on top of everything. 

Nuts, get the f*ck out of my curries!

Christmas Eve and all the Indian/Pakistani joints in the TL were packed, so we snagged a table by the door. Surprisingly tasty bhaigan bharta, and I liked the big chunks of eggplant. This could have used a kick of spice though. Eggplant and onion lovers, get this dish. Chicken tikka masala met the minimal (see: low) expectations I have for this, so I was satiated. The disappointing dish was the lamb vindaloo, which was more like ketchuppy lamb with potatoes? Naan was on the doughier side, but totally fine.
author: Kevin L.

description:
First time here, won't be the last. I went at the time between lunch and dinner so I can't speak to the wait times or speed of service. My bf and I were the only ones in the joint.  

Garlic Naan: delicious. Chewy on the inside and crispy on the outside...garlic but not too much garlic.

Goat curry: if you don't like goat, get out of here! The man behind the counter suggested we order this dish and he didn't steer us wrong. The meat was tender and flavorful. The sauce was full of spices and not too salty. 

Chicken korma: stole my heart. Creamy, yummy, again, not too salty (I find that it's easily done). If you're wondering what to get, get this.

Don't be intimidated if you see a roach on the wall. They too like good food. If you leave them alone, they will leave you be...true tenderloin spirit. 

Thank you for a wonderful meal!
author: N ..

description: Funky atmosphere, BYOB, good food, I'll be back many more times. Very very turnt and not at all burnt----- the turn up here is most definitely real #datfooddoe 9/10
author: Ember T.

description:
At 5:30 their food hadn't been delivered yet. He requested that we wait 15 minutes. We ordered samosas and waited and waited and waited. We saw the employees cart huge vats to the kitchen. Food here! 4 tables who arrived after us got their food. 

The man at the counter chastised me for not placing my order earlier.dude!  I gave you my order but you failed to write it down. 

4 year old and 2 year old have just that much patience...plied them with panda puffs and hoped there was no melt down. Its not often we come to Sf from SJ and the prospect of looking for another place was daunting.

45 minutes later food came to our table. Lahori fish was outstanding. Karahi chicken is a ripoff ...very very oil and barley any chicken. 

Nan is average. 

Its SF lots of options...but if I crave lahori fish insanely then I might venture in again
author: M G.

description:
I think their food is great. Only Tikka Masala has better food in the Tenderloin. Shame on the reviews that gives props to Chutney's food. You guys are high or have shit palates.

Anyway, despite good food this place has TERRIBLE service. Way too long for food and absolutely not a hint of friendliness. I work in a restaurants, I am very sympathetic towards long waits for food. I usually know why the wait is long because I understand how kitchens work (generally). This place just doesn't want to make your food. It either picks and chooses what tables they want to serve first or has no idea of how to efficiently expedite their way through orders. They do not take any priority towards to-go orders either. Usually I call to order, wait 15 minutes,  go down there and once I show up and ask about my food, THEN they make it. I had a disaster of a to-go order recently and that was my last straw here.

My favorite place,  Tikka Masala on Ellis also has long waits for food but I look back at their kitchen and can kinda see why. Plus their owner and/or counterperson is friendly and helpful. The people at Lahore Kahari are straight up assholes. Seriously. 

They do have good food though. I love their chicken tikka masala and most of their lamb curries. Their goat curry was boney but the sauce was amazing. All their naan is good.

Its dirty but so are most Indian places. I don't care too much. Chai is on par with other places.

I'm not just bitter over one visit. I have been receiving terrible service and inexcusable wait times over years. Even when the previous owner was there. Fuck this place.
author: Dash_Rendar _.

description: I ordered take out and Naan and Curry are really really good. Where as Vegetable Biryani was wet and did not taste nice.
author: Traveller P.

description: Love their food. I've been here a few times and everything is made fresh and consistent. Their Garlic naan is yum. We ordered kourma, chicken tandoori, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, fish curry, and daal. I would suggest to go there with an empty stomach cause it's a lot of food! Love it .
author: Jennie C.

description:
This place is near my house. 

I'll say this, the food is decent enough, they have good window ventilation, and they have the ball game on the TV so its a good option if you're in the mood for Indian and want to catch the giants game. 

That's what I'll say about the place.
author: Nick L.

description:
The worst experience I have ever had. The staff ignored our whole party for 10 minutes. We asked them if they were open and they replied yes. And then they proceeded to ignore us again. 

The waiter was talking on his Bluetooth and giving us cut eye whole time. 

We left without any service or food. Never going back again.
author: Kim D.

description: Ordered take out and was disappointed. The curries were rather watery and this extended to the taste.
author: Theo S.

description: Good quick service. Plenty of space for guests. The taste is authentic and menu options are great. Try the Saag Paneer and Chicken Korma. The Korma, however, was kind of unexpected because that's not how I am used to it. The naan are fresh and hot and probably that's why I ate just too much. Can't get enough of fresh oven-hot naan! Free tea so help yourself.
author: Zaki S.

description:
Me and my satanic, devil-worshipping ex-gal pal ate here often. I still do but she ran off to be with Satan in his hellbent orgy circus. I ordered love and she ordered lies with a side of sex with every man she met. 

At Lahore, I like to order the Chicken Tikka Masala, an order of rice, and a garlic naan. That will feed two people and it costs less than $15. You can't beat that deal. The tea is free. Drink up, glutton. 

It's the best of its kind in the neighborhood. BYOB though. 

I give it 5 stars because I frequent the place. I pretty much order the same thing every time. It's cheap. It's consistent. Other Indian/Pakistani restaurants in the area are either too dirty or just not as tasty. 

The staff has always been chill and nice. That is always key for me. If you were to serve me a plate of garbage but were friendly and kind and nice and sweet about it, I'd come back for more trash. Thx so much.
author: Sethy Wethy ..

description: It was our first time here and trying out Pakistani/Indian cuisine. The place is just Ok but the food was very flavorful and affordable!
author: Des L.

description: Not authentic Pakistani taste anymore.  Has more of Indian touch now but still good food
author: Arsalan K.

description:
My buddy and I came here for lunch on President's Day.  If I was going to base this review on the service, I would have to give it 2 stars. We ordered a Veggie pakora as an appetizer, a butter chicken and a tandoori chicken for entrees, and garlic naan and basmati rice for sides.  They forgot our pakoras which is when I drafted the review and saved it as 2 stars.  

That's when the food came out.  It was great.  The garlic naan was the best naan I've ever had.  It was so crispy and hot.  You can't fake that freshness.  The entrees were good, but not much better than at other indian restauarnts in the area.  The onion naan was not as good as the garlic one.  

It was a reasonable price for two starving guys.  The garlic naan alone was worth the trip.
author: Richard T.

description:
Be aware that this is a straight hole in the wall. After having seen this place on T.V., and all the reviews we had to give it a try. I'm not exactly sure what all the rave is? This is not a full service restaurant. You have to get your own drinks, and order at the counter. The only drink options are some cans of soda in the fridge, some kind of tea, and water I guess that is in some type of containers in the fridge. A whole tableful of used glass water containers sitting to the right of the fridge was a sign that someone had not done dishes in a long while. Gross.

 I asked the cook if he had any chili sauce or something spicy to accommodate the meal. He told me no, but then said he could make up something. He basically took some type of chili powder and mixed it with water creating a paste. The dry powder on the edges of the little bowl were a dead give away. 

The food lacked any flare and quite frankly was a bit on the bland side. We had Chicken Tiki Marsala, Lamb Vindaloo (described as hot on menu but is not), rice, and Chili as well as Garlic Naan. The Naan was good, and the Lamb Vindaloo was not gamey at all. 

Another odd occurrence was the arrival of a couple of men in a van. They came out with a large plastic container containing some kind of sauce, as well as a plateful of Samosa or something that looked like it. That tells me they make some things off sight. That's not comforting because things made off sight need to be at the right temperature for transport, and who knows where this stuff was made? 
 
The restroom was very small and the toilet cleaner sitting there right next to the toilet paper...well...odd. It wasn't overly clean and the place is run down. 

This was hardly a food experience that had "wow" factor in a positive way. There is so much better out there!
author: Polska K.

description:
Came here the other day and got the baingan bharta, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and plain naan. 

The baingan bharta (eggplant + peas) was spicy and had a great flavor to it, but did not find much eggplant in it at all? Even so, was quite tasty. 

Chicken tikka masala was flavorful and a little sweet, but the chicken chunks were very dry. I'm pretty picky about my chicken and like for it to be tender and moist, so would not get this again. 

Plain naan was better than the garlic naan. The garlic naan was overly crispy and not as tasty as it looks. I like naan to be soft and squishy, like eating a chewy cloud, and this was not it. The plain naan is more naan-ish than the garlic one, for less than half the price ($1 v. $2.50). 

Overall, solid place with reasonable price-to-portion ratio. Will be back to try more!
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
There's probably at least 10 different varieties of Northern style Indian food (Mughlai, Punjabi, etc). I'm not exactly sure where LK fits in, but every dish we ordered from the baingan bharta, lamb kebabs, lamb gosht, and the ctmasala, was overly sweet?! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5zKrxtjKK09F_Dwgs5Kxwg?select=AtpAG734e_AEy0daFbagKg) Where's my spice yo? 

Eastern Indian food is known for their sweets and the people from Gujarat in western India add a pinch of sugar to almost every dish! Maybe LK is a hybrid? Inside there wasn't a single Indian patron, bunch of hipsters though. Definitely, Americanized Indian food. 

I like how their food wasn't overly oily like Shalimar and we didn't go home completely smelling like we baked in the tandoor oven aka  Naan n Curry. So LK might be a good spot if you're looking for some of that chicken tikka "marsala" before some good times in the 'loin.
author: Earl G.

description:
The indie/paki food in the tenderloin is so good it's actually hard to be disappointed. 

Lamb vindaloo - so good and legitimately spicy. Lamb isn't gamey at all n sauce is very delicious

Chicken Karahi - oddly enough this was the only Karahi dish on the menu even though this place is named Lahore Karahi. It was good but not as good as the Karahi at shalimar 

Okra - very good and well seasoned. Okra wasn't slimy at all which is usually the case w most okra dishes
author: Mai C.

description: I come here for the tandoori chicken. Service sucks. Totally non existent customer service. Tandoori chicken and the garlic naans taste good though.
author: Sarfaraz S.

description:
Nan was very good, so is Tikka masala,  the spinach dish good also.   Fish tandoori is a bit overrated.  Not enough flavor. 
Wish the food come a little faster. Otherwise not bad.  
Thanks.
author: Alex R.

description: Was very hungry from skating for a bit came across this place. I love Indian food so I know good when I taste it. The lamb spinach was very bad because the lamb tasted like chicken and the rice tasted like it was burnt. I'm not the kind to complain but the food could much better
author: Nicole C.

description:
I used to love Lahore Karahi, loved the benghan bartha, the food was exceptionally good.  But things are different after Guddu is gone. 

Service is absolutely terrible.  As in. Non-existent. I don't need waiter service, I don't need someone to get me water/chai whatnot, I'm perfectly aware of how most Indian restaurants are run. 

I did not get served at all.  Walked in at 4 in the afternoon, could not imagine it being super busy.  Put some bags down, friend and I head to counter.  There were a couple of cooks, no acknowledgement. We wait 5 min.  One cook comes to answer the phone.  Not even a glance, and the phone is less then TWO FEET from where we're standing.  We fidget a bit, not sure what to do, hoping he will come back as we have menus in hand.  Nope. Went back to take out orders. Awkward. We left.

How am I supposed to give a good rating to a place that seems extremely uninterested in serving food? I'll take my money elsewhere.  Thanks. 

Not worth it anymore, food is not what it used to be, service is extremely bad, so bad that you won't even get to order food.  They don't even want your money.
author: Yingjue C.

description:
I ordered delivery, and the food arrived warm and in a respectable amount of time.  I was also able to get mango lassis delivered (awesome).

The vegetable biryani was a little bland and I wouldn't recommend the saag paneer from here.  But the samosas and the chicken makhani were ok.  And the prices are pretty decent.
author: Riz W.

description: Great, reasonably priced Indian/Pakistani Cuisine in the ghetto Tenderloin neighborhood of SF.
author: Victor L.

description:
As a self proclaimed subject matter expert (SME) on pakistani/indian food, I was extremely disappointed in Lahore Karahi. I had heard good things about the restaurant, so I was excited to try it. But, as many things on Yelp, this place was all hype. I've been to practically every Pakistani restaurant in the tandoor-loin, and Lahore Karhai is literally one of the worst. The food was SO BLAND, I question if they are even allowed to call themselves a Pakistani-Indian restaurant. 

A friend and I ordered the following: 
- Beef Seekh Kabob: Horrendous. Had absolutely no flavor or seasoning. 

- Palak Aloo: Extremely bland, but not terrible. It was probably my favorite dish of the evening, but thats not saying much since everything else was gross.
