- Karhai Chicken: When your restaurant has the word KARAHI in it, you'd think you'd want this dish to be your bread and butter, a dish to show off. Sadly, Lahore Karhais karhai chicken was amongst the worst i've ever had. 

- Garlic Naan: The naan was legit. I'm a tough critic, but I genuinely enjoyed my garlic naan and for this sole reason I am rating this place TWO not ONE star. 

In conclusion, the food capital of Pakistan, Lahore, would be ashamed to have such a mediocre restaurant named after it. 

Lahore Karhai, you let this Pakistani girl down. I will probably never come back to eat your food. Next time, i'm not going to cheat on Shalimar or Mela.
author: Moniza M.

description:
Had the lamb boti and aloo naan for lunch. I would have to say that both were fantastic and flavorful. The lamb was tender and delicious with flavor. The aloo naan, the potato made it a soft texture and it made the meal hearty. Only other thing I know about naan is if they (restaurant) messes up on that, you're in for a bad surprise on the other dish. ;) 

If there has to be a complaint, the wait was longer than expect (sat for about an hour), but it was worth the wait. I would definitely be coming back again to try out other stuff on the menu.
author: Daniel K.

description:
A year ago, my husband and I were eating dinner with his parents in Calcutta. His mother ordered a coriander and corn soup which was so spicy that I declared "the pores on my scalp are opening up." I literally felt like my head was sweating. I don't remember it as a good feeling - just as a strange feeling of being both warm and cold simultaneously.  I had that same experience at Lahore a few nights ago.  I can't say that I know what anything tasted like (except that the aloo saag was heavy on fenugreek and light on aloos) aside from incredibly, stomach-gurgling-ly, pores-on-scalp-opening spicy.  If you like red chilis in just about everything, even in your daal, this might be the place for you.

On the plus side: This wasn't quite as divey as I expected based on reviews - in fact, there were plenty of folks enjoying a Friday night date when we were there two nights ago. I don't mean to suggest that this is a romantic place (it isn't) but a few reviews described it as smoky and grimy, and it was neither. Just slow and spicy.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
A Whatever restaurant.
Food was less than mediocre.
Dal makhani was simply boiled dal.
Ughh..never going back again...
author: Shruti S.

description:
2nd time to Lahore Karahi w/ my 2010 SF Entertainment coupon.  It's on 612 O'Farrell St (@ Leavensworth).  Easy walk from the Asian Art Museum or Powell St Bart.

We got:

Garlic naan $2.5 - fine.  Comes w/ cilantro & I noticed sesame seeds on top.  Like a thin pizza.

Daal masala $5.5 - yellow lentils cooked in mild sauce.  It was tasty.

Matar paneer $7.5 - green peas cooked w/ cheese in mild tomato sauce.  I didn't notice any cheese, saw some potatoes in there - weird they didn't mentioned potatoes.  Tasted ok.

Tandoori Fish $11.95 - fish marinated w/ zesty herbs  spices.  I think they added lime for us which I don't mind.  It was nice & tender white fish maybe swordfish?  It was pretty good, comes out sizzling w/ onions & cabbage.

mango lassi $2.5 - nice

rice $2 - fine, enough for 2.

Subtotal w/ coupon & Tax (not tip) was $28.95

Hrs: Tu-Su 11a-11p
Credit cards over $15
Halal Meat
author: Ann L.

description: Bad service. nobody even come to ask if our food is good or not. plates , spoons, water pitchers are dirty. food was just ok.
author: Raa Na M.

description:
Lamb vindaloo and aloo paratha! I love indian food for it's immense amount of flavor. Every bite was a kick in the mouth! The lamb vindaloo is a bit spicy so beware. The side rice is also seasoned with spice and mint leaves. The curry was rich and thick. The aloo paratha was pretty good as well, hot and fresh when they serve it to you and it's so soft. I only wish they had sauces to go with it.. instead of just naan by itself.. 

Very laid back atmosphere, everything is self served. You come in, order at the register and chose your table. Water, plates, utensils are all on you.
author: Virginia Y.

description:
I used to have this theory that if you used Yelp correctly, you should never have a 1-star experience. At least here in SF, with so many great options available for any cuisine, there's no excuse to end up at a bad restaurant. Thanks to Lahore, that theory is now busted.

You see, at the time of this writing, Lahore has a solid 4-star rating with 830 reviews. Pretty safe bet, right? Wrong. So wrong that I'm busting out my first 1-star review just to express my disappointment in the most bizarre dining experience I've had lately.

It all started when we showed up about an hour before we had to be at a party down the street at Bourbon and Branch. A perfectly generous amount of time, even though it had taken a little while to get served here in the past. The first sign of trouble was when we had to actually take our own order at the counter. Not just give our order at the counter to someone who'd ring it up, but actually write it down on a waiter's pad and deliver it to the chef ourselves (It was so weird that I had to capture photographic proof: http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=o03ZwIhEEbKLxffxBmcuUw&select=99knUe5k4ySIbAw864G9Qw). We laughed about how this couldn't be very efficient, but in retrospect I think it was the most efficient thing about the restaurant.

Once the order was placed we found a seat and waited. And then waited some more. 30 minutes later it seemed weird that not only had we not seen any food come out of the kitchen, but we hadn't seen a server or anyone else come by our table either to let us know what was going on. When we could track down the server and ask what the holdup was, he quickly said our order was coming right up. Slightly placated, we returned to waiting and got distracted by a Bollywood movie playing on TV. This kept our attention long enough to make it through four dance numbers and some google sleuthing to figure out that it was called "Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham" and was the highest-grossing Bollywood film in foreign markets when it was released. Obviously this occupied a good chunk of time, and when we finally looked at our watches again it had been a full hour since we ordered.

A normal person would have realized they'd been played and left. Crazed by hunger, I instead set my iPhone's timer for 10 minutes and declared that we'd be leaving if we still hadn't been served when the timer went off (60 minute wait? No big deal. 70 minute wait? Inexcusable). For the next 10 minutes we sat and watched the clock, joking how our food would come out as the timer was buzzing. Then, like magic, our order appeared with 1:18 left on the timer. Instead of any sort of acknowledgement about the wait, the server just dropped our dishes off without a word and disappeared back into the kitchen. Stunning.

If you are still reading this, I can only assume you are stuck sitting at Lahore Karahi, waiting for your food and reading reviews trying to figure out where you went wrong. To save yourself some grief, may I suggest you get up now and head over to Shalimar, Chutney or Little Delhi? It's not going to get any better here.
author: Mark A.

description:
One star...yup, haven't given out one of these in a while.  I guess I've been pretty fortunate so far with where I've been (which is something I'm quite appreciative of).  But then, it's not everyday you see a ROACH while you're eating.  Yeaaaaah....game over.  Thanks for playing.

Now, before you write this review off as a one star just because of a roach...well, you're partially right.  Seeing a roach certainly put this one a one star path, but it's not like I found the rest of the experience that fantastic anyways.  Unlike other Yelpers, I didn't find the food that remarkable the first time I was here a year or two ago, and it really wasn't any different this time around.  

Between my two friends and I, we ordered the Garlic Naan, Regular Naan, Butter Chicken, Fish Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, and the Saag Paneer.  As a whole, nothing really stood to me as being anything special.  The Fish Tikka Masala was definitely the best of the bunch, as they did a good job with cooking the fish.  Even then though, it didn't strike me as amazing flavor-wise.  Decent, but not great.  And while none of the dishes were bad per se, it's not like you can't find something just as good (or better) elsewhere in the City or the Bay Area.

Considering the fact that we had to wait almost 40 minutes for our food and that they still forgot our order of Tandoori Chicken, Lahore already wasn't going to be getting anything better than two stars before the roach showed up anyways.  Now, I'm not so naive to think that roaches aren't a problem at other places, including those that I'm actually fond of.  However, there's a BIG difference between suspecting or thinking they might be around, and then actually seeing the damn things on the wall.

If people want to keep coming back because they think the food is still great despite it all, then by all means.  That just means the lines will be shorter somewhere else.  I just know I won't be back, and I wouldn't even give it a second thought.  The only part that I'll still be thinking about is whether or not it was a good or bad thing that we didn't see the roach until towards the end of our meal.  Ugh...disgusting regardless.
author: Mike L.

description: The fish curry, chana sag, and garlic naan were all quite tasty but for some reason my friend got sick (while I didn't). The only thing she had which I didn't was the mints and pepsi. So beware of those I guess?
author: Misha T.

description: It used to be nice but not any longer. We asked for spicy food, and a few additions. None of them were added to our order. When complained about it, it was rudely dismissed. Biryani tasted more like sweet rice.
author: Mihir G.

description: I would like to give a 3 or 4 star review bc the food tastes good, but after spending hundreds of dollars on pickup food and never getting one order on time, I can't bring myself to speak well of the place. Last time here for me!
author: Kyle T.

description:
I give them 3 stars because the Giants game was on and the free tea was solid.

We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Vegetable Korma, and Garlic Naan.  We later realized we needed rice.

The chicken was dry.  Although they cook to order, the chicken and other items are prepared ahead of time and sitting out.  So, that explains it.  Otherwise, the flavor of the Tikka Masala was fairly well rounded and a bit sweet.  We asked for spicy and it was not.

The Vegetable Korma was gross.  It lacked variety of vegetables and tasted chemically.  Some of the vegetables tasted pickled...maybe.  Either way, fresh it was not.  It was disappointing to say the least.

The garlic naan was nothing to write home about.  I did not get the impression it was fresh.  The garlic was a boost, but not enough to save it.

Based upon the reviews, I was disappointed.  I do not think I would go back.
author: Kiki I.

description:
Little pricy for the TL but if you're craving indian this is a good go-to. Portion sizes are moderate, taste is incredible, and it's all made fresh. I wish entres included rice or some side vegetables, for the price they really should. One item (tandoori chicken) came with a few raw onion slices on the side which were awkward to eat, raw onions and chicken don't go together.

You can order online which is very convenient.
author: Brandon N.

description: Waited over an hour for fish curry that never came. What really ticked me off was their dishonesty. I placed my order and watch everyone who came in after me receive their orders; over half an hour later i decided to ask if my food was ready and the cook proceeded to explain that everyone has to wait 15-20mins for their food. I decided to be patient and take his words for it. Another half an hour went by and every other client had left. I had them cancel my order. They didn't even have the decency to apologize and muttered something about a misunderstanding. If they had forgotten my order, it would have been all right if they had pointed that out earlier and apologized. If my time is going to be disrespected like so, i'm never coming back. if i had known it was going to take so long, and if they are going to forget my order twice, i would have left earlier and not be so upset. I get that i have a small physique but that does not give them the upper hand to be disrespectful towards me.
author: Mabel T.

description:
Amazing food especially delight for non-vegetarians. Tandoori and Lamb and Goat dishes are finger-licking good. My usual order is Goat Bhuna which is very tasty and I keep eating the same dish each time I go there. Service is slow though and so if you are in a hurry eat, use order ahead or call in your ordere else it's at least a 20 mins wait.

They can custom make the dishes too. eg. a friend of mine asks to replace chicken with paneer in chicken karahi as he loved the gravy.

guys who work there are silent and shy so don't mistake them for being rude.
author: Srinivas R.

description:
Great food for the price!

I was here with some friends. We just wanted to find somewhere to eat, where we didn't have to worry about food poisoning or weird people. It was off hours, around 3pm.

We happened on Lahore Karahi, and I was surprised by the prices! The prices are cheaper than places I have been to in the East Bay or South Bay. 

We had to go up to the cashier to order, but we paid at the end. 

Extra star for free chai masala. Mango lassi was good.

I ordered some paneer dish. My friend ordered a different dish, and the sauces did taste different. I hate it when you order different dishes and the sauces are the same, but that was not the case here! I could definitely taste a difference between the different curries. I guess that means everything is made to order. It did take a while to get our food.

One order of naan wasn't enough per curry dish, we had to order a side of rice.

Boyfriend's dish was forgotten, which I heard later on Check Please! happened to one of the reviewers. It was funny when the waiter noticed my boyfriend wasn't eating, and he looked at the cook who shrugged his shoulders. They ended up bringing his dish...maybe 20 minutes after we got our food. Boyfriend's fault. He should have spoken up :)

If I was in the area, I'd definitely come by, if I wanted good Indian/Pakistani food for a good price.
author: Poiuytrewq A.

description:
Small spot but good atmosphere very cosy feel and best thing the food is good. 

Support small business, dont kill'em.
author: Bash C.

description: The best Indian food in SFO till now. Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Vindaloo,Garlic Naan,  Veg Biryani, Chicken Biryani Must try.. amazing test. Delicious. Highly recommended.
author: Omkar P.

description:
Unfortunately, as others have stated, this is the 'Guddu-less' Lahore which is nothing special anymore.  It's still crowded because the guidebooks haven't caught up to the fact that the owner has changed.

Too bad that there's not another top notch Indian/Pakistani place in the 'loin anymore.
author: John T.

description:
Good solid Indian food and I would rank this a 4 star if we did take out but the in house dining experience was not something for Sunday date night. 

Naan is fresh outta the oven and full of garlicky deliciousness!
author: Nho C.

description: Excellent food must try Lamb Bhunna and butter chicken, only need to work on ambiance and cleanliness.
author: Faisal K.

description:
This place has been on my goto indian spots list for a long time. It used to be run by a single pakistani guy that did everything. Now it has an updated interior and is run a little bit more efficiently, they seem to have 2-3 folks working here now. I'm not sure what happened to the nice smiling pakistani guy that used to run it, maybe he sold the place to a private equity group ;). 

You can expect inexpensive indian food that's quite good. I've been going here fror at least 6 years, so I think I this reviews carries a little bit more weight than normal :).

Enjoy.
author: Michael S.

description:
The place is not that impressing but the food is delicious! 
The garlic naan is outstanding and the chicken tikka masala is really good!! 
The two are my favorites but over all I tried other things too and it's really good.

TIP: If you like spicy food, ask for the green peppers in your rice bowl - yum!!
author: Michael L.

description: Damn!  This place exceeded my expectations!  The garlic bread was so good we ordered another round. I believe the best we've had!  Our chicken Marsala was superb!  I will be back...
author: Dennis S.

description:
What a tasty, down-and-dirty hole in the wall.  4 stars, though I'm tempted to give it a 3.75 because the wait for your food is really long.

Between the four of us, we ordered three naan (1 regular, and 2 garlic), a plate of rice, the bengan bhartha (eggplants mashed up), saag gosht (lamb in spinach), chicken tikka masala (a safe staple, no explanation necessary haha), and the tandoori fish.  

How was it? Alright, here we goes:

+ Bengan bhartha: slightly sweet and creamy, this mashed up eggplant dish was a good complement to all the other more flavorful and spicy dishes.  Goes well with the rice.
+ Saag gosht: nice, fatty pieces of lamb, in goopy spinach, but not quite as goopalicious as, say, the standard palak paneer that you'd get in places.  The consistency is more like mush, less like goop.  Still good, not too spicy really.
+ Chicken tikka masala: Excellent. Do get. My favorite dish of the evening.
+ Tandoori fish: way too much lemon! The fish was tender and nicely cooked, but they really over did it with the lemon.  I would've preferred if they just gave us lemons on the side, so that we could squeeze our preferred amount of acid on each fish.  But yeah, they oversqueezed = no bueno. 

Everything is super fresh and cooked to order, unlike the pre-cooked stuff at Naan 'n Curry (though, I do love Naan 'n Curry too...).

The naan was fine.  Puffy, soft, and just the way I like it.  Regular naan is only $1! 

I also tried the mango lassi, which is like, amazing! The chai is free and unlimited, and VERY creamy, and oh did I mention freeeee? :D  Am happy!

All that food came out to $45 before tip, which is reasonable.  

My two main issues were that 1) the wait to order and then the wait for your food is kind of long, and 2) the place is...not the cleanest.  But oh well, the former is expected since there's only really a few people cooking the food, and as for the latter, what do you expect from a hole in the wall Indian place, right?  It would be like expecting service in a Chinese restaurant. 

Overall, good, straight up Indian food.  Not mind-blowing, but it's done well. 

*Note: ignore all the "we serve to go food only" signage.  This place is definitely still a sit-down place.
author: Vivian C.

description:
Food = delicious.  Reasonable portions. Water and chai tea is free.   Saag paneer, delicious; chicken tikka masala, hot and delicious; their basmati rice (I'd rather not repeat that.)   Their tandoori fish is very delicious, served on a sizzling plate and plentiful!

Service = self-service.  Order at the counter, sit down and wait at the table (and wait you will, it takes 20+ minutes for the food).  Get your own silverware, plates, water, and good luck finding the napkins.  

When you're done eating, go back to the counter and pay.  If you want to take home leftovers--get your own containers from their station.  

Prices = reasonable.  Pay in cash.  

Overall, I'd be back but I'm not going out of my way to do it again.
author: Fannie S.

description:
Authentic (but mild), delicious and cheap!  The tandoori, curries, naan and rice are all fantastic.  You can close your eyes, point to any random item on the menu and be happy with your selection.

This place is a bit different with the self service policy.  I had to ask other patrons where to find the napkins and was told to "check behind the counter".

You also have to be patient here.  The kitchen will get backed up because the place gets crowded and there's only one person cooking.
author: Zoran L.

description:
OK/Average Indian food. It does not stand out compared to other Indian restaurants. I went there with a friend for lunch on Monday. The place was almost empty there were about 3 other people who came there during lunch hour. The restaurants and tables were clean. You order at the counter and self-serve water, free tea, plates, and silverware (very common at other Indian restaurants).

We ordered Tandoori Fish (Good), Baigan Bharatha (Eggplant Curry)(ok), and Chicken Tikka Masala (ok). The eggplant dish could have been better. I would try other Indian restaurants in the neighborhood before coming back here.
author: Sid P.

description: Good food, slow service. Read amazing reviews about this place so I thought I would give it a go, but wasn't too please by the enclosed atmosphere or service. Food was okay.. not the best place for authentic Pakistani food.
author: Sabrina G.

description:
Very good for vegitarians, the Tandoori flavors are outstanding! 
Nice clean place, the staff is very good.
author: Joe H.

description: Amazing, great customer service, the food was on-point, complimentary tea. Interestingly enough I think they have this one Asian worker speaking in Pakistani. Had to do a doubletake, but hey, this is SF, that's awesome.
author: Alan L.

description:
Solid 4.0 for Karahi's, a quaint restaurant that serves very good Pakistani food!

The food is real. You see the chefs preparing your food in the corner and you can smell the spices as each are thrown into the pan.

- Rice: good, decent... not too dry, not exactly fluffy.

- Mango Lassi: YUMMY! Probably my favorite mango lassi from anywhere... :) perfect mango flavor and a slight tartiness from the yogurt.

- Chicken Tikka Masala: decent, not the best I've ever had.  It was slightly spicy for me even though we requested "mild."  The chicken could've been more tender but it wasn't exactly dry.

- Garlic Naan: probably the highlight of Karahi's.  It was one of the best naans I've tried--it was crispy, doughy, and 'reeked' of garlic... just the way I like it. Did it go well with the Chicken Tikka Masala? Yes!

The ambiance is decent; there aren't too many seats available but the service is good. The waiters were quick and very helpful.
author: Jenny O.

description: They make really great Samosas!
author: Theresa D.

description: I had an out of body experience having lunch here yesterday.  Thanks to all of the Yelpers out there for your recommendations.  The garlic naan and lamb vindoori was simply amazing.  The lamb vindoori was spicy and amazingly flavorful.  I am going back today to try another dish as it is my last day in town.  I too will be haunted by this experience because that meal ranks number one of all time.
author: Steve J.

description:
This place offers the best Indian food in SF.  (However, it is still not as good as when Guddu was in the kitchen)  Service has improved immensely though.

Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Ghost, and Vegetable Biryani every time!
author: Alexander F.

description:
Food is good, not great, and service is horrible. I have been here a few times to give this place a shot, but i give up. This time I called ahead for a to go order. On arrival there was no line.  You would think the instinct of the host would be at least to acknowledge me - nope. I sat there and waited a good 5 minutes until a buddy on his came up and asked to order a few more items which took another 5 minutes. By this time the line is backed up and I ask to pick up my order. Turns out they ran out of one of the items so they haven't started my order.  I pay wait another 15 minutes and the see my food on the counter. I ask the guy for my order - he ignores me and after a few more minutes gets my order. 

Based on all the great reviews I am hoping   I just have bad luck, but I saw a lot of other unhappy faces while waiting. 

It is a shame - place could be great.
author: Nikolas K.

description: This food is bomb, really tasty! It got a poor health rating but to me it felt authentic, I would come back for sure.
author: Judy C.

description:
Most excellent Pakistani cuisine. 

I liked this place way more than Shalimar, the block is less sketchy and the dining room is more quiet, clean, and relaxing. The food was excellent and it's authenticity and quality got high marks from my Pakistani friend (who happens to own another Pakistani place elsewhere in the city).

The proprietor is a friendly chap and gave us a goodbye and smile as we were leaving. 

A new favorite for me in the Loin!
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Went here with a friend for dinner the other day...food was okay but nothing spectacular; things were a bit on the salty side. 

There wasn't much service to speak of (except for them taking our order...at the front counter/not at our table) which is fine because it seemed like a casual dining place. Given this fact, I didn't think it made sense to leave a tip.....

Low and behold though, I checked my bank account n they added their own tip. Dishonesty is not the way to make your earnings...
author: G L.

description: Love their goat curry: if not, get out of here! We were suggested we order this dish and he didn't steer us wrong. The meat was tender and flavorful. The sauce was full of spices and not too salty. I will love to come back here again!
author: Arnab K.

description: Absolutely disgusting and down right filthy. We walked in here based upon Yelp reviews. No acknowledgment by the staff as we walked in and seated ourselves. After ordering our food, we see a cockroach walking out of our menu onto to the table. We immediately asked for our ordered to be canceled and walker out with out any hesitation. Somebody please call OSHA on this place.
author: Pardeep M.

description: The little hole in the wall Indian restaurant with the delicious flavor of real Indian food from Punjab. We orders two dishes and rice and 3 Naan,  because usually the Naan are so small and flat that you need at least that many. The Naan here are huge and thick and fluffy and filling,  one was enough,  the curry was fabulous,  the mango Lassi tasty,  the Chai complimentary. I am pretty sure they make the paneer there.
author: Anthony E.

description:
First time visitor - will not be coming back. Here's the good, the bad and the downright ugly...

FOOD:
The food was ok, not great. Veggie samosa average.The food was nicely spiced, but the goat curry my boyfriend had was very runny with a distinct lack of goat, but with an abundance of bones...and vertebrae at that. I had the the eggplant curry, which was decent. Onion kulcha was burnt, and the garlic naan did not look or taste like it was made with fresh ingredients. Also, uhm, don't drink the water, it did not look or taste potable. Felt queasy when we got home, but boyfriend did not seem to experience any ill effects from the food.

Recap - food ok. On a 1-5 scale, maybe a 2.

WAIT:
Be prepared to wait. It's a small hole in the wall, which has limited staff. On top of that, it seems like only one person was cooking, with three others doing other stuff that was not customer-related. It mostly looked like they were standing around on the back-line, but I could be wrong. Plenty of time to observe what else was going on, as the wait was so long.

AMBIANCE and CUSTOMER SERVICE:
Ambiance was lacking, but is not usually a deal breaker for me. Although in this case, I could have done without the rolls of toilet paper on top of their drink fridge or the slew of unbussed tables. 

Speaking of which, don't expect anything from the customer service - seat yourself, come up, order at the kitchen/front-end and expect yourself and your needs to be ignored. We were there for an hour with 2 other tables being occupied, and at no point did ANYONE buss any of the empty tables with dirty plates and food still left on them. We did, however, see a customer buss a table by moving the last guests remains to another table and then sit down. Simply unacceptable. 

Also, while we where there, they were restocking their pantry it seems. I really could have done without seeing boxes of okra and basmati rice everywhere. I have worked extensively in food service, and if you don't have a back door, you NEVER get deliveries during business hours - the whole point is to focus on your customers, and not on everything else. 

CLEANLINESS
This is where this place gets some serious dings. Tablecloths with black dirt stains at the edge where they meet the clear plastic table top, broken soap dispenser with watered down soap in the bathroom, bathroom in general not in any great state of cleanliness, "Order Here" sign with big grease stain, kitchen visibly dirty from where you sit and plastic water glasses with cracks in them. Not good. 

All in all, this will not be somewhere we will re-visit.
author: Elena T.

description:
A fab cheap and cheerful indian restaurant n downtown San Fran.
It's tiny, you help yourself to water and all the faves are on the menu.
It is BYOB though - never a bad thing but something that was unfamiliar to member of our party of 7. So if that's you, it goes like this:
Not all restaurants are licensed to sell alcohol (it costs money to get the licence and takes time)
They encourage you to take your own wine or beer.
They sometimes charge (huge) corkage cost to compensate on lost profit but this one doesn't.
Good, affordable Indian food including veggie options.
author: Rickie J.

description: I've been here a few times, but never got around to writing a review. Today I had the chicken tiki masala and cheese naan. OMG it was amazing! Just walking into this joint gets me excited. The service is ok, but the food makes up for it 110%. As a local TL resident this is definitely a go-to. Thanks for the best indian food.
author: Gus M.

description:
The walk from Van Ness at 10PM - questionable. The traditional Indian food made fresh with each order - worth it. Dinner generally ranges from 11-15 for each of us when we go, with Naan, tea, an entree and started... pretty amazing!

The food tastes amazing.. I've tried my fair share of Indian in SF, and this competes for the title of best flavor. 

BYOB without any sort of corking fee which is lovely. The Chicken Korma, Sag Paneer and Lamb Dal (spicy!) are some of my favorites :) 

Definitely worth your time - it'll be one we frequent often.
author: Tara K.

description: Awesome restaurant for a place close to my apartment. They offer online to go ordering and it takes approximately 15 minutes. The price is reasonable for the amount of food and it tastes awesome! Don't be deterred by its location and curb appeal because the food is great.
author: Joyce P.

description: I've been dreaming about Lahore ever since I moved out of SF.  In fact I had a dream two nights ago where I took the Pope and his crew here for dinner and we all loved it.  I miss you
author: Bill K.

description: Ordered lamb vindaloo. It was nearly flavorless. Sauce is supposed to be red but this was an orange Brown color. Ordered very hot and it was a little hot. Small rice costs $4. The garlic naan was delicious and nicely oiled.
author: Silver T.

description: Always a good experience. Food is consistently delicious. Prices make it even better. Definitely our favorite Indian restaurant.
author: Maribel M.

description: The best goat curry and chana masala i have had so far!! If u r in this area and are looking for good food , this is the place! Highly recommend!
author: Manpreet R.

description:
The food here is solid. The Chicken Boti Tikka was pretty amazing. So moist and flavorful. Chicken Tikka Masala was also very good. For starters, the Chicken Cheese Naan was so good. The vegtable samosa was the weakest, not enough flavor and a little bland. But overall, the food is very good here.

3 stars is due to really slow service. We were there for late lunch.. we were the only ones in the restaurant. We asked for water.. he gestured towards the fridge for us to get the water carafe ourselves. There were a few tables that remained dirty with dishes and never cleaned the whole time we were there. And he took his time cooking our food. So service is very lacking. 

So... my advice is maybe try it and see what your expereince is. You can do takeout also.
author: Vol T.

description: OK, the neighborhood is awful, but the people were nice (even if overworked), the kitchen is open, the place is small, and the food was really good (e.g., korma, bengan bharta). The chai was especially good (was it a bit more cinnamon and cardamom?).
author: Veg V.

description: I have tried almost everything on the vegetarian menu. The food is mind blowing. Especially the cheese naan....that's the best. This used to be my regular spot when I lived in downtown SF. It's probably the best naam and curry I've had here.
author: Megha J.

description: Absolutely fantastic. The garlic naan was amazing, and the garlic wasn't just tossed on but could be tasted throughout the bread. My boyfriend and I shared the lamb vindaloo and chicken tiki masala (which is my personal favorite) and they were cooked to perfection, the curry was delicious. The affordable prices sealed the deal. We'll definitely be back again!!
author: Jillian F.

description: If I pay for delivery I expect it to my door, not to be badgered by the gentleman doing the service that has been paid for to meet them somewhere more convenient for them.
author: Caleb R.

description: I'm not exactly sure how this place has accrued an average of 4 stars. Had I gotten take out, I'd have been a lot happier in my ignorance of what goes on inside the restaurant. Now, I wasn't expecting glamor considering the humble location. However, two unruly toddlers running around, the horrendous state of the women's restroom (looked like it's rarely cleaned & no toilet-flushing mechanism?!) and 2 cockroach sightings (one on the toilet, one on the wall where we were eating) left a bad taste in my mouth to say the least. Fortunately the food was tasty, but we relocated tables mid meal due to the cockroach. When we paid up front, one of the employees asked why we'd changed tables, and I told him. To this he replied that they were doing some kind of renovation, old building, etc. The lac of cleanliness here will keep me from returning; undoubtedly there are cleaner Indian restaurants in the city where I'll gladly pay slightly more.
author: Stefanie Q.

description:
When a bunch of Yelp employees cannot stop talking about a restaurant in SF, you know it has to be special. After all, these people spend most of their days trying the newest and hottest in dining all around the world, sipping obscure cocktails and eating flavored foams. 

Well, Lahore Karahi isn't new by any means... in fact, it looks like this place has been here, tucked in an unassuming part of the Tenderloin, for centuries. And the only 'hot' thing in this place is the generous helping of fiery spices in the dishes. And to top it all off, when we went in last week there was no alcohol allowed, so not even a cocktail to be seen!

This place made me realize, however, that when the food's good, none of that other stuff is necessary. All we had was a simple table setup, friendly and attentive service and some mind-blowing dishes, from enormous veggie samosas to incredible spicy rice to amazing curries and those delectable veggie fritter things (forgive me, Indian/Pakistani food experts... I just eat, I don't read) and amazing, fluffly naan. I think my favorite was the tandoori fish, which made my hair smell for the rest of the night but it was worth it!!

In true form, we ordered much more than our stomachs could hold but the food was so amazing that I just kept shoveling the stuff in my mouth because it was all so delicious. 

I can't wait to return to this place on my next trip to SF. I have plenty of Indian food-fanatic friends and they're sure to fall in love as hard as I did!
author: Christina P.

description: Sadly, as expected, with Guddu's departure, this place is dead. The food was so-so. Took us 50+ minutes to get it. The service was surly. The food was MEH.
author: Andrew K.

description: Second only to Shalimar (and only ever so slightly). This place is outstanding and the staff is very friendly
author: Martin R.

description: Not terrible, but bland and not particularly clean. Of course, I have been to India five times, so I know the best place in the world for Indian food - Sunnyvale!
author: Patrick T.

description: I'm very surprised by the high rating for this restaurant because it was very filthy and as I was sitting eating my dinner, a cockroach came out of now where and sat on me. I freaked out and I asked them to move my food for me. Overall the food is decent. Better than most of the Indian/Pakistani ones I've tried in the area but they need to work on their cleanliness and their customer service.
author: Ashaba C.

description: Great food, few places are on this level when it comes to taste. On the other hand, the quality is a bit inconsistent -- there have definitely been a few off nights -- and most disappointingly they have a pretty serious roach issue. I've eaten here over 20 times and never been ill, but my last visit there were roaches ON MY TABLE. Still three stars because the food is awesome, but they need to clean this place up.
author: Max A.

description:
OOOOHHHH Lahore... what have you done? I know you changed owners and I appreciate the face lift, but can we please bring back some of the FLAVOR FLAVE!?  The chicken tikka masala was watered down, the naan over-cooked and crispy and the aloo keema just isn't the same. It just seems that some of those wonderful flavors that used to be poured into these dishes have vanished. I miss my creamy, spicy and rich flavors. 

Honestly, you've become a (not as good) version of Shalimar. I miss you ORIGINAL Lahore. 

But, I will be back because you have a TV and when I want some decent Pakistani food while a game is on, I can come in and watch it.
author: Noneya B.

description:
We were looking for some desi food in the TL and this was the place that popped up closest to where I parked my car. I had not yet consulted Yelp, my friend and I just randomly picked this place.

There are 100 reasons I shouldn't have liked Lahore Karahi. Here are three of them
1) too many white yuppie diners, zero South Asians
2) food took freaking FOREVER
3) one ancient waiter and one busser so service was beyond slow ...

BUT .... when the food arrived -- tandoori lamb chops, naan, lamb biryani, butter chicken, papad -- it was SO FREAKING INCREDIBLY DELICIOUS that I almost plotzed. It was like being in some auntie's kitchen and tasting the most delightful symphony of flavors. The biryani had lots of yummy crispy bits, the lamb chops were huge and searingly hot, the butter chicken buttery!

Our feast came to $28. 
It was really really good food.
Now am beginning to think it wasn't so random after all.
author: Lisa T.

description: I'm not exactly sure how anyone couldn't rate this place 5 stars. We ordered butter chicken, daal masala and garlic naan; and it was all outstanding!
author: Rick J.

description: Absolutely incompetent. I ordered food and waited an hour before calling when I got no notifications from the restaurant. They said they would call me back so I waited another 30 mins. I called again and they said I had to call Grubhub and sort it out with them. Didn't seem to care at all that I had already paid for a meal and that it wasn't delivered.
author: Suheil T.

description: Great food, but just a warning not to use your credit card to pay for your to-go order on their website. I got a fraud transaction immediately following.
author: T D.

description: Ordered the lamb biryani and it was very good. Delivered after 60 minutes as promised. Will try the chicken tika next time. Nomnom!
author: Jay G.

description: I loved it , i went on a vacation to sanfran with my brother and  we loved the food it was very satisfying (: and their green chutney was so delicious .
author: Naila A.

description:
After several years of consistently enjoying meal after meal here, last night seemed different. Most of the tables were empty. A new sign stated that it was self service. The owner-chef Guddu was nowhere to be found. I finally pieced the clues together upon leaving: Guddu had sold the place. Today, I see on Yelp a number of reviews lamenting this transition. If only I had checked!

I ordered usually strong dishes: lamb vindaloo, saag paneer, naan, and rice. The quality seems roughly on par with other City locales, but that only means you no longer have to go out of your way to come here. It was my top destination for Indian food. Now, even the free chai tea lacked the usual strength in spice.

Prices are roughly the same as before, about $6-8 for each entree. Portions are a tad smaller than the glory days, so you'll need at least one entree per person, plus the usual sides.

The average should be closer to 3 stars, not 4 stars, for this establishment. It's possible that things will improve, but without the original recipes, this storefront has become just another address on a block in the Tenderloin.
author: Randy M.

description:
This place has come under new management recently, I believe the old owner moved back to Pakistan with his family. I had a conversation with the new owner and head chef and he told me he has been friends with the owner for a long time and promised to keep the same quality standards of home style food as has been already built up after all these years. I have actually noticed the eating area of the restaurant has been freshened up a bit and is cleaner than before which is nice to see given that the old place was pretty much a hole in the wall.

My favorite dishes here are the Tandoori Chicken Leg, Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Korma, and Garlic Naan. Occasionally they have posted specials like Goat Curry which are definitely worth ordering, so check the board behind the counter when ordering.
author: Mark Y.

description: I am obsessed with this place!  The food is amazing. Saag gosht is the boyfriend's favorite, the garbanzo bean or tikka masala with their super flavorful naan. The staff is really nice too.
author: Michelle G.

description:
VERY SAD NEWS EVERYONE!!!  The management/owners changed awhile ago and so did the food.

It may be faster and have freshly painted walls, but the food isn't nearly as mouth watering.  

Personally, I'm on the hunt for a new favorite.
author: Lani P.

description:
Disappearing mangoes.

Progressive kind: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HTPjsdaRryY

Chutney kind: Lahore Karahi's didn't last long.

Spread on naan. Scooped on top of tandoori chicken. It works. Especially all at once.

Chicken is spiced with some kick and comes sizzling on a platter with onions. Just the right amount to be full without overdoing it.

Orders are taken at the counter and then delivered to your table. Kitchen is visible behind the register. Was fascinated watching the cook. It's a small but ambitious space.

While not the best Indian in the city (check out recent fav Mela http://www.yelp.com/biz/mela-tandoori-kitchen-san-francisco-2#hrid:oo2DOPgFs2j7aWRCUlu44Q), low prices, good food and established reputation earn them four stars.
author: Jason B.

description: Great Indian food! The bengan bhartha was awesome and the garlic naan was some of the best that I have ever had. Only reason that it is lacking a star is the ambiance. Not a date place but a perfect place to order in from or stop by for a quick bite
author: Molly M.

description: I didn't expect food would be that awesome. The place is a total hidden gems in the middle of tenderloin amongst billions of indian restaurants.. don't expect nice and fancy place, but this is totally reminds me how indian restaurants in singapore's little india look like. Food are amazing, menu are simple.. overall pleasant experience for a hungry girl :)
author: Orie L.

description:
Do you want perfectly spiced curries, fresh-off the Tandoor meats, piping hot naan, and free Chai?? Then go to Lahore Karahi!
Wait time,service,decor,ambiance??? I don't know! I stopped noticing these things when Kormas and Vindaloos arrived.
author: Loubna M.

description:
I've come here quite a few times, but not recently. This is a favorite spot among my friends, and is often chosen as the location for birthday dinners. I have only been here with a reservation or quite a long time ago, on a weekday. 

This is a one man shop! The chef/owner is really friendly and he runs the show here. When it's not crowded, he'll come to the table and tell you all about his specials. Listen to him! His specials are the best! 

I love the bottomless chai in the corner. Just grab a cup and fill yourself up! There's also a water cooler over there too. Double fist that and bring those back to your table.

The food is tasty and I like that this restaurant features some unique items you're not likely to see at other Indian/Pakistani restaurants, especially the specials like the carrot pudding. I think most of the times I've been here the chef has prepared an off-the-menu specialty for us.

The service is slow, but I think if you're not in the rush, it's nice. This place is also BYOB (without any charge), so it's a fun place for a leisurely meal with friends. Make a reservation if you can, or come early; this place is small and it fills up fast and stays full. 

This place is located in/near the TL, and the decor isn't anything worth mentioning. The tables are cramped, and sometimes there's some interesting Bollywood movies playing on the tv up in the corner. The prices aren't a steal, but I suppose they're appropriate for normal SF dining.

I'm skeptical if things have changed because of the lower reviews, but last I went, this place was great and definitely worth a visit!
author: Rebecca G.

description:
I really like the new owner, he's a great guy, super friendly and very nice.  And I really want him to do well and wish him the best of luck, but really the food just isn't as good as it used to be under Guddu's ownership.

The fish tandoori has totally changed.  It's made with tilapia now instead of sea bass, which is a drastic change and the recipe is completely different.  Nowhere near as good.

I'm really disappointed because Guddu was an amazing cook and hasn't left his best recipes behind.  What a pity.  But the new owner seems really open to feedback and he does care about the quality of the food so hopefully it'll still continue to be an above average place for dinner.  In fact the owner was nice enough to offer me a steep discount on dinner when I expressed my disappointment with the fish.  Like I said, great guy, but the quality has dropped since Guddu for sure.
author: Chaz N.

description: I've tried almost every pakistani restaurant in San Francisco and this one is my favorite. Hands down their food is the best in the city!
author: Mariam A.

description: We've been here multiple times and have loved the fast service. BYOB is great too. The portions are just the right size to allow you to order multiple items. I think the chef on duty that night has a lot to do with the flavor. We like it for cheap and good Indian food!
author: NJ A.

description:
Too spicy food for nothing. Please eat if you would like to have a heart burn or destroy your stomach. The spice takes all the taste away.
On top, you have to wait for an hour.
It is not worth the wait.
author: Qasim M.

description:
RUDE & DIRTY!
The food was ok, nothing special and NOT a good value either!  Our party of three was hungry and decided to give this place a try, should have walked right back out after the non greeting and lack of interest in our ordering / patronage!  Food was okay, nothing special considering all the great options in the area, that have great food, friendly people and service in cleaner establishments!!!  They were not busy at all yet three tables remained unavailable due to not being cleared during the length of our half hour lunch. Our first carafe of water was dirty, Yuck!  After our meal they seemed just as disinterested in us and even in taking our payment!  The man at the counter rudely snapped at another customer that she could not order naan, ala carte!
There is NO EXCUSE for contemptuous service like we experienced, even on the 4th of July!  
GO ELSEWHERE!!!  YOU DESERVE BETTER (don't you?)!!!!  
Happy eating, drinking and yelping!!!
author: Sean M.

description:
Really good food and courteous service.  

This is more cafe than restaurant with an element of self service, the staff were friendly and the food way better than the typical American presentation of food from South Asia.
author: Chris A.

description:
Tonight was one of those nights where you wish you'll wake up the next day and realize that it was all a dream  Unfortunately, the reality hit me when I tasted the food from "Lahore Karahi" tonight, and the reality is simple:

Lahore Karahi is gone.

This yelp page should shut down and start over as they seem to be at "Lahore Karahi".  I truly apologize to the new owners, who seemed nice enough, but to even pretend that your food is the same as that served up by Guddu is like saying that the Niners and the Raiders are basically the same team.  The food was nowhere close to the same.  

Where to start.  The saag paneer (one of my favorites by Guddu) was a bit more leafy, not pureed as Guddu's was.  But even more challenging was the lack of flavor to the saag.  This seemed to be the trend in the dishes me and my fiancee had tonight.  The karahi chicken was a tad dry and was definitely short on the flavors of before.  The lamb vindaloo was lacking in tenderness as well as quantity of meat.  Finally, the naan was just in a completely different league.  The stuff we had tonight was a lot spongier than that served up by Guddu.  

I would like to say sorry to the new owners for immediately reviewing rather than wait until they find their legs.  However, tonight's food was such a drastic change from before that I felt it necessary to warn people who might be looking to see if the new ownership is close to recapturing Guddu's flavors.  They're not.  I gave The New Lahore Karahi  three stars rather than two simply because I don't know if it's really all that bad of food.  It just isn't as good as Guddu's.

Finally Guddu, if you are sitting there reading this right now just know that I was very lucky to eat your food.  Just last month I tried you fish for the first time at your insistence and I am forever grateful that I did.  You have a gift and I hope one day you will be ready to share it again with us.  Thank you my friend.

P.S.  The 5/7/12 5 star review is a bit suspicious to me.  The only review a person from way out in GA has written is about a small Pakistani restaurant in San Francisco?  Doesn't make sense.
author: Ben L.

description: I eat here all the time. For me, the food is 4 stars, the service is 2 stars. The dishes range from good to excellent depending on who is cooking. The service is poor to mediocre... There is this one guy who consistently gives abysmal service at the register. Once I stood there for over a minute while he tapped away on his phone without looking up. Normally he says nothing, which is OK, but  today he treated me with disdain. It's not just me, I hear it from other regulars too. I'll still continue to eat here because it's convenient and the food is pretty good... but I'll start branching out more in search of tasty food *and* friendly service.
author: J D.

description: Best Indian/Pakistani food I've ever had- the spices were incredible- clean and inviting place.  Well worth a trip to the city - the chicken tiki was to die for! Can't wait to go back.
author: Gwen O.

description:
Oh the Loin...so many great restos...so few flak vests. Juuust kidding...kinda.

Regardless, I was pretty excited to dive into this place with its famed Pakistani cuisine. No joke, ten of us shared a multitude of dishes and the total bill was just over $100. Niice!

A few highlights:

Samosas: Deeeelish! Perfectly cooked and a wonderful mixture of spiced potato-y goodness.

Chicken Tikka Masala: great bird with incredible sauce. I really loved this dish.

Naan: I could eat all types of their naan all day long...and they even had one kind with cheese?! Nom.

Aromatic rice: Not sure of the formal name of this dish...but it had a cinnamon stick in the middle. Super flavorful and a great option for the veggies.

Yum overall! FYI: no alki-hol or BYOB here!
author: Nicole W.

description: If taste is all that you are looking for, this place serves the purpose. One of the best place to have indian food in the city. However dont expect a very hygienic place or excellent service. Also be aware of the area you are walking around.
author: Vabs S.

description: Best Butter Chicken ever but a bit pricey! However I come here anyway, their garlic naan is great too.
author: Anneke B.

description:
One word....Cockroaches  (Oh..Ohhhhh...)

My fiancé, his friend and I were seated right away from a friendly waiter.  I sat close to the "white wall" towards the back of the restaurant.  We ordered our food and were super excited to eat authentic Indian food. 

We were chatting away.  All of a sudden, my fiancé's friend gave a "look" to my fiancé.  Both their eyes were drawn to the "white wall." I slowly turned to my left.  And there it was...Just crawling next to me.  (Photo of where I saw it: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/5zKrxtjKK09F_Dwgs5Kxwg?userid=ei6Z52YF1UyTVaMQOYubPw
(Luckily, I'm glad I didn't yelp out loud in the restaurant.)  o__0

We grabbed the waiter's attention about the bug. He casually just got a piece of napkin and killed it in front of us. (OhHhH, myyyyy goodnesss...) 

After this experience....We noticed the following:
-dirty dishes/utensils on the floor 
-more creepy crawlers roaming around the floor
-unclean

From my understanding, this can be a serious health and sanitary issue.  So, we ordered our food to go because we were uncomfortable eating here.  When we got home, we all agreed that the quality of food was very tasty and good.  And, no wonder why there are so many reviews. 

All in all, any place with these creepy crawlers gets a 1-star.
author: Deborah C.

description: I was a regular to this place for over a year and the service was never friendly or quick. The food is pretty good, the Naan is very good. I stopped supporting them just because of the unfriendly service. Try going to Pakwan 1 block away, food is tastier, and service is great!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Used to be off-the-charts good. A completely different league compared to Chutney and Shalimar. Unfortunately Guddu sold this place and now its just ok. Bring Guddu back!

Edit: Yelp should wipe all comments and ratings for this restaurant. It's not longer the old Lahore Karahi it used to be when Guddu was running this business.
author: Bjørn R.

description: A reliable outpost in the Tenderloin when catching a nearby show, made all the better with their BYOB policy. Piping hot naan and veggie somosas, well-spiced dishes, and reasonable (though not bargain) prices have kept us coming back for years. I generally stick to the lamb or vegetable dishes, but occasionally have sub'd in goat and always have left quite pleased.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Teeny tiny place that I would have never found without Yelp!

Was in the mood for some authentic mediterranean food and went to my go to source to see what it would recommend and found this place.

The hubs and I walked here from Union Square (it's not really in the Tenderloin and the walk was pretty safe)

Definitely a family feel to this restaurant that seats no more than 25 people. We came here on a Friday night and the place remained fully occupied the whole time we were there.

We tried a little of everything: tandori fish, chicken tikka masala, chicken kebabs, onion naan, and basmati rice. Our host was really nice, he told us "you ordered enough food" and advised us not to order the pakora we wanted. we liked how he actually told us not to order more!

If you are really hungry you might want to get a little snack before you come here because the food definitely takes its time before it gets to your table. 

Chicken Kebabs and the chicken tikka masala was definitely delicious. We finished every bite. The naan and the basmati rice equally tasty. The only thing that we didn't love was the tandori fish. Maybe next time we will try the tikka masala fish.

Loved the value and the home cooked feel of this place. Would definitely come back or order to go from here.

Note: the bathroom is dirty, make sure you use it before you come here!
author: Betty C.

description: My absolute favorite Pakistani-Indian restaurant in the city, and so far in the world. The Benghan Barta eggplant dish is amazing and I highly recommend it. The naan, of course, is a must have. And, in general, all of the flavors and spices really stand out. I'm ordering some right now and am so stoked for this delicious meal!
author: Michael F.

description:
On a cold windy San Francisco day Lahore Karahi Pakistani Indian Cuisine is a great place to hunker down for some excellent Indian food. Its faults are few, none of which have anything to do with the food. 

I arrived for lunch just after noon. The place was small and deserted, which generally is not a good sign during prime lunch time.  Not to worry, I settled in and ordered the Lamb Vindaloo, Basmati Rice and Garlic Naan. After a short wait my food arrived. It all looked great. I found the Vindaloo to be some of the best I have eaten, the lamb was lean and tender, the potatoes perfectly cooked and sauce not a bit greasy and perfect sinus clearing heat. The rice nicely seasoned and cooked perfectly. The Garlic Naan to put it simply, the best I have ever eaten. Portions were excellent and would leave most people plenty to take home.  Service was good; however since I was the only person in the place it's hard to judge if there had been a crowd. Décor is nothing special but clean. Entrees in $9 range.

It's a bit tough to find fault with Lahore Karahi, nit picking faults: Not the greatest of neighborhoods, its safe just a bit rundown though not overly so. The serve only canned soft drinks and bottled water.  I saw no beer or wine.  

Lahore Karahi Pakistani Indian Cuisine is hard to beat if in the mood for Indian or a cold windy San Francisco day. As a matter fact a great choice any time.  This really is stellar food.
author: Dave J.

description:
This place used to be the best Indian/Pakistani food in the City--despite the fact that it deserved a C, or D for cleanliness. Then, recently, I believe, the restaurant came under new ownership. Things have since rapidly deteriorated. Tried-and-true dishes that were top-notch before, including Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, Lamb Boti and Lamb Biryani, were not nearly as good as they once were under former ownership. The Tikka Masala and Saag Paneer were especially disappointing--the former being a flavorless soup with bland chunks of chicken and the latter among the least appealing I have had.

I would recommend Shalimar, or Chutey if you want good Pakistani, Lahore just fell off.
author: Steven W.

description:
Lahore Kadahi is a little different from the other Indian restaurants that I have frequented so far. Not different as in the selection of food but in the flavors. 

I particularly remember the "Daal Makhani" which was very authentic in it's flavor but could use a little more softening of the lentils/grams/sprouts (Daal encompasses lentils , sprouts , and chickpeas that it's hard for me to say which is which). If it was a little more "mushy" (for lack of a better word, and I agree it does not sound very enticing either --- ok, let's go with "creamy") I would surely rate it as the best in the area. 

The other dish they execute way better than *ANY* other Indian restaurant (save Viks in Berkeley) is the Alu Paratha, or the potato stuffed Indian bread. It's still not quite a paratha but more naan/tandoori-roti, yet they executed it really well that I had no cause for complaints. I'd highly recommend it. 

I made the mistake of ordering the kebab platter (I think it had beef, chicken, and possibly, lamb kebabs) and realised it was way too much meat for one person. It is best shared by three people. 

The other dishes were standard fare and pretty good but did not jump forth like the aforementioned so I don't remember. 

Just be forewarned: your clothes will smell like dinner once you're done due the combination of ventilation that could do better, and the nature of spicy steaming-hot food from the subcontinent. 

I had sampled their desserts of Kheer (rice pudding) and Kulfi (frozen spiced reduced milk) and they were on the spot !!!

I'd recommend it.
author: Umesh T.

description: I have frequented Lahore usually for dinner about once every 2-1 months and always get the fish tandoori, naan and raita.  This time for lunch I tried the chicken kabob (comes w 2) naan and raita... I was a tad disappointed as first of all I ordered at 1230 and food didn't come out until 1246... I had to wolf down my food ASAP... Anyone on a 30 min lunch may try another place.. ( of course I didn't finish all of it either) I won't take off a star for that because it did come out freshly made and piping hot.  Plus I rarely come in for lunch but I do recall now the one other time I came in for lunch that it took about the same time and we were all sweating looking at the clocks.  The kabob had some spice but lacked flavor- almost dry.. It would have been better if they marinated it first. Garlic naan good.. The funny thing too is- I always ask for a smaller raita.. This not just Lahore.  I don't need the big sizes that always go to waste but they always give the big sizes... Cost effectiveness? Oh we'll probably not that much. I'm taking another star off because of the bathroom. Handle was broken- it actually pulled out when I tried to flush! I thought it may not flush because of it but I pushed it back in and it did thank gosh..no toilet paper and soap dispenser was a mess w no top.  Like I said I like Lahore and used to go there regularly but they need to ramp things up a bit if they want to be competitive.. There are just so many other choices in the city for same price fast service great taste and clean amenities.
author: Margo R.

description: Great Food! Shalimar is usually my go to but this place is just as good! The chicken tiki masala was excellent. Not spicy at all but I forgot to specify so it was nice they erred on the side of caution. I hate ordinary Indian food. This place is anything but ordinary. Super authentic. Fast service.
author: Christy T.

description:
Indian food to Jenna F. and me is no joke. We don't f. around. Especially not Jenna F. That b. is no f.er. 

Our weekly dinner date rolls around, and its my week to pick. This week in the land of legal eduaction sucked some major b's. Thus, I made the decision. It was time. Time for Jenna F. and I to quit f.ing around and try some S.F. indian. 

Yelp, you did not let me down. But because law school has left me f.'d in the head, I f.'d around hard deciding what stars to give it. Below is my thought process:

I subtracted a star for the amount of oil in my Aloo Ghobi. F. thats a lot of oil....

Then I added a star because of how home cooked and REAL it was. F. that s. was home cooked!

Then I subtracted a star because when the waiter came back, and we were ready to order more DELICIOUS garlic naan, he handed us a check. And we didn't get any more delcious garlic naan. =( F.! that naan is great!

Then I added a star for the delicious garlic naan. F.! THAT NAAN IS GREAT!

Then I added another imaginary star because our food was F.ING FANTASTIC!!!
author: Emily D.

description:
Feroze, u guys are awesome.
Loved ur food and will definitely come back soon to cherish this taste again...would recommend to one and all!!
author: Samir M.

description: The taste was ok. But it was not a clean restaurant. Not a good ambience too. 2 stars just because of the taste.
author: Vinod C.

description:
We ordered in the other night, and usually I don't give reviews based on service, especially when I didn't physically eat there. 

However, we ordered at around 7:20 pm on a weeknight, and we were told that it would be 20 minutes until our order was ready. This was perfectly fine, so we show up a little after 20 minutes later to make sure it would be ready. Because it was sort of during a dinner rush, I wasn't surprised or upset at all when the cashier said it would be 5 more minutes. However, it ended be more like 35 minutes by the time I got my food, which is way more than double what they said initially. By the time I was getting home to eat my food, it was well over an hour after I had first ordered. 

I was also fairly annoyed by the experience because despite the rush and obvious line of people, the cooks didn't seem to be in any sort of hurry and moved very lethargically, and the service wasn't all that pleasant either. There were a few other people there who seemed pretty miffed and annoyed at how long it was taking as well. 

Anyways now on to the actual food: It was pretty tasty. I love Pakistani and Indian food and so we ordered the Onion Kulcha, Aloo Paratha, Aloo Keema, and Bengan Bharta, all of which were pretty good. I would have probably given this place 4 stars if the service had been better.
author: Yishian Y.

description: Great indian food, really give you the Monteczuma's revenge.
author: Corey P.

description:
Got takeout from this place the other day, ordered the butter chicken and plain naan. There was nothing objectionable about the food but, and maybe this is because I was just in India, it was nothing to write home about. The naan was denser than I would have expected/liked, and the butter chicken was more or less indistinguishable from a tikka masala. The sauce could also have done with being thicker.

Perfectly reasonable for the price, but if this is the best Punjabi food in SF then that's pretty disappointing.
author: Max A.

description: Very rarely do I give one star,but the service and atmosphere were horrible.  Should have left when we had the chance, but we're starving and the food was actually good . They did not greet us or explain how the process worked. Do we order at counter or be seated? Very rude. Did not speak one word to us just grunted. None of the tables around us were cleaned up, and the area around cash register would not pass health inspection or fire inspection.   Overall it was a very disappointing experience, and I cannot comprehend how they have four stars. Will not be back..
author: April M.

description: One of the worst experiences I've ever had in the city. We walked out after waiting for well over 40 minutes for our app. This place is garbage ... Was amazing years ago avoid at all costs..
author: Jayson E.

description:
Karahi Chicken had amazing taste. Chicken Boti Tikka was also really good and sizzling hot when it was served.

Had prawns Biryani also but It was good enough... Not as great as other dishes.

But overall good place to have tasty food.
author: Nilesh G.

description: Great Food. I've been coming here for the past 4 years and love it. It's a hole in the wall place.  It's a small place and is visited by regulars so be prepared to wait for table if you are coming after 7 PM. Service is also a little slow BUT food is delicious , inexpensive and it's a BYOB. Yes , so get some beers or white wine and drink while waiting for the food. I like the vegetable Korma the best there. Tell them to make it spicy it tastes great. Enjoy !
author: Vikash G.

description: Hands down one of the best Pakistani Indian restaurants in the city. The chicken tikka, tandoori fish, biryani and the masala curries were all delicious. As good as it gets.
author: Gopi V.

description:
This place was a pleasant surprise! We loved loved LOVED the garlic naan!
It is a must try for everyone and very reasonably priced!
Added bonus = free chai! Can't get better than this :)
author: J K.

description:
We stumbled onto this place while cruising the Tenderloin and loved the food. It's one of those little unassuming hole-in-the-wall places. The crowd was happy, the food was tasty and the prices were great.

The tablecloth was under glass but still dirty. The guy taking our order couldn't be forced to smile and I can usually break through to anyone. But it was a fun experience and we'd return. 

You order at the counter, grab some glasses, and help yourself to a carafe of water from the fridge. People around us were bringing in their own wine from a nearby store.

There were three of us. We got 3 orders of naan. Each piece was huge! Nice flavor, perfect combo of crisp outside and tender inside. We got 2 orders of rice. It was a little dry, like it had been cooked quite a bit earlier, but still flavorful. We also got an order of chicken boti tikka and some aloo saag. They were great. Was surprised the tikka didn't come with lemons, it seems to in most places. But the meat was flavorful and cooked properly. The aloo saag was tasty and spicy, but not overly so. The potatoes had good texture. 

Our total for all of this food, with plenty of leftovers, was $28. Amazing! If we lived nearby, we'd be regulars.
author: Sweet A.

description:
I read somewhere that this place serves very spicy food. No. (At least not for Asian standards?) However, it's a great little hole in the wall that does do what matters most on a regular night out - serve very tasty food for a reasonable price.

If you expect fast service, you won't get it. On a Friday night (we went on 02/19/10), there was only one guy seating everyone, taking orders, and occasionally clearing tables. Be patient and make sure you remind him if you decide to order additional dishes midway through your meal. Also, if you've asked for chutney, don't wait for it. Get up, use your hawk-eye to find it yourself and get it. Just watching him attend to everyone in that rushed manner made me feel a little bad asking twice for it (although we never got it anyway).

We ordered:
* 1 ALOO PARATHA - Naan stuffed with spiced potatoes and fresh cilantro - $2.50
      - [4/5 - Very oily - dab it with a napkin and it's GOOD. Note: I'm used to a little more stuffing in parathas. And 1 paratha for 2 people just isn't enough.]
* 1 CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA - Chicken breast cooled in creamy tomato sauce - $7.50
      - [4/5 - A little less spicy and even ever-so-slightly sweeter than I'm used to, but very good.]
* 1 LAMB VINDALOO - Boneless lamb cooked wlpotatoes & spicy sauce - $7.50
      - [4/5 - Good amount of spices - not really spicy though, very tender lamb.]

We wanted samosas but they weren't available that night.
author: Asha S.

description:
Not sure what impact review #904 will have, but I have 2 words: GARLIC NAAN.  I ordered the chana saag and it was amazingly flavorful.  It paired well with the naan and plain rice.  

Minor drawback is that your hair/clothes/jacket will come out smelling like spices, but it's well worth it.
author: Sona P.

description:
And so it begins. The great Indian duel: Lahore vs. Shalimar. 

In my mind, the two are somewhat different in origin and nature, but similar in level of quality and many other attributes. Both are light years beyond anything I get in Portland, and could easily duel with some of my more favorite spots in Seattle. 

I finally got in to try Lahore, which is a fairly (but not too) dirty hole in the wall over in the 'loin. The dishes (the ones I care about at least) like curry run in the $7 range, and consist of a decent sized bowl of pungent, earthy curry with meats and in some cases, potatoes and other veggies. Upon my visit I opted for 2 of my lodestar Indian dishes - Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Vindaloo, with some rice and naan, of course. Both ordered medium spicy. 

The meal was delivered quickly (the place was empty when we were in there) and the food came piping hot. The chicken tikka marsala was heavier on the cream/yogurt and lighter on the tomato than usual, and it made for a surprisingly good alternative to my usual favorite. The spice level was perfect for an order of "medium." The flavors were complex and, as indicated above, both pungent and earthy. Delicious. 

The vindaloo was the star of my personal show. The lamb was tender and juicy, and most importantly, plentiful. The curry itself was a nice, dark brown, You can tell the curry base was not over-processed, so random chunks of distinct flavors came bursting from the sauce with each new bite. I'm a big fan of non-homogenized flavors, and this delivered in spades. 

The naan was the only really not-impressive part of our meal, but that said it was still pretty decent naan, and I wouldn't hesitate to order it again. At $2.5 for a fairly small portion, I wasn't super stoked on the value. 

Overall, 2 curries, one naan, and a rice came to $21.50, which is not a bad deal for a filling dinner for 2 in the City. The lack of ambiance actually adds to my experience at these types of places, but if you're looking for a "white tablecloth" place to take a first date, this ain't it. Plus, with the pungent smells of cooking curries and baking tandoori chicken hanging heavy in the air, you and your dinner companion will be stankin' like Indian food all night long. 

So yeah... I was a Shalimar devotee, but my dinner at Lahore has officially split my devotion in tow, and I am torn. Either way, it's a high-class problem to have!
author: Don B.

description:
Went there last night for the first time after the ownership change.  While the food was still tasty, it wasn't as exceptional as before.  I think the prices went up too.  

We ordered fish tikki masala, beef shesh kebap, butter chicken, saag paneer and an eggplant dish (+naan, rice and raita)

The fish tikki masala was pretty tasty.  The saag paneer was pretty standard.  The eggplant dish was good but I remember it being more flavorful before.  

I was thoroughly disppointed by the butter chicken.  This dish used to be one of my favorites and unfortunately the taste has totally changed.  The chicken is nowhere as succulent as before and the sauce was very average.  Boo!

The shesh kepab has also lost some of its tastiness from before and in addition to that was on the dry side. 

I will probably come back at some point but definitely not as often as before.
author: Nhan N.

description: I can't believe I haven't written a review for Lahore! This place is my bf's FAVORITE restaurant. He is a super picky eater but when we started dating I wanted to take him to one of my favorite cuisines as he had never had Indian before. I had been here once before and thought it was pretty good so brought him and the best friend here. HE FELL IN LOVE and we come here at least once a month every month. Now he has his coworker and his gf hooked and we just love it. The people here know us now obviously and are always very friendly. Its BYOB and they have awesome butter chicken and tandoori chicken. Oh and garlic naan! There's more but just GO! Its great and super reasonable! You won't be disappointed!
author: Sarah S.

description:
When it comes down to Indian, I can get really picky. Maybe it's just because my dad cooked curry for us almost every DAMN DAY of my childhood. I learned to grow accustomed to all the spices of the middle east and south asia. Curry, masala, cumin, saffron, cardamom, you name it. My parents grew up eating kulfi, malai, and all that  cardiac health goodness and often crave those sweets.  I've never been a fan of those milky desserts, but I comply.

We were actually aiming to dine at the Sultan down the street, but we found out that they still hadn't opened. I wonder if they're even going to reopen... ever. Anyways, a quick search on Yelp led us down to Lahore Karahi. Off we went.

Our waiter was very nice. He treated everybody with respect and went out of his way many times just to answer my talkative dad's many questions.

We ordered a garlic naan, two regular naans, tandoori fish, chicken biriyani, and a mixed grill platter. We all absolutely LOVED everything. The biriyani was amazing. The rice was perfectly cooked, not too soft, not too hard. The fresh aroma of the cilantro blended nicely with the turmeric and other spices. The food definitely wasn't overspiced the way most "Indian" restaurants do it. Everything was light with the right amounth of flavor. The garlic naan was delicious as well. The tandoori fish was very tender and fragrant, but it was a bit too sour for my liking. I think I tasted a bit of tamarind as well. It would've been nice in a salad. The lamb and chicken on the mixed grill platter were very tender and juicy. Oh, don't forget to eat the vegetables that accompany the meat! The onions and lettuce that came along with the meat tasted soooo sweet and  good. Mmmm....

They roll the kulfi right in front of you. In fact, they make everything in front of you since the kitchen is out in the open. My parents enjoyed the kulfi and malai a lot, but I didn't eat it so I can't say much about it. They said it was heavenly.

We are definitely coming back. This is definitely one of the better Indian places in the city. 

Good stuff!
author: Colleen W.

description: This place is not a good place to recommend. We sat there for 40 minutes and was served burnt Pakoras. Place is also filthy. Bad customer service! Had to walk out from this place...
author: Sjngdyanu C.

description: The food here is amazing. I am so glad I live so close by. My favorites: chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, tandoori fish, and garlic naan.
author: Andreia G.

description:
Crusty rice from the bottom of the pot, watery butter chicken, and the world's saltiest tandoori fish left a bad taste in my mouth.

Even the mint chutney was extraordinarily salty; I'm not sure how you can get that wrong. I'm talking an order of magnitude here in terms of the salt level -- I made the mistake of putting the chutney on the fish and it literally tasted like I was eating a spoonful of salt. The saag aloo, surprisingly, was bland with no salt at all. Either that or our taste buds were fried from the fish and chutney salt bomb.

To their credit, the naan was quite good and the butter chicken was spiced nicely, but overall I'd say there are many better options in the city.
author: L D.

description:
First off: The food is so darn good. Any place that has indians double parked 4 deep waiting for take out ( they are so smart, more on that later) all night long is a clue that the food must be good. Walked in and sat down and someone brought over menus... 10/12 minutes I am trying to get his attention to order and he is at the counter not paying any attention to the dining room. I call out to him that I want to order and he points up to the ceiling to sign ( because of the lighting no one in our group of 4 could read) that says to order at the counter. We ordered at 8pm and got our food at 9pm!!!!! NO SERVICE OF ANY KIND. You get your own silvereware, beverage, napkins, etc. But the food: OUTSTANDING!!!! It has to be the best Indian food in SF.
